Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Darren K
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience - clean, impeccable service, great location. Arrived early (10:30am) expecting to ask if they could mind my bags - not a problem, they had a room I could have immediately. Great pool, gym, restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Easter Show deal”
Reviews.Author: CanberraDni
Reviews.Content: Their Easter show deal is great value. The room was clean and tidy, a bit small but thats what you get in the city. Breakfast and parking were included and the breakfast was fantastic! All the staff were great. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TieTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sebel quite frequently for business and appreciate the central location, proximity to the hip restaurants in Surry Hills and the free internet I get as a GHA member. The hotel has a nice lobby, friendly staff and decent breakfast. The rooms are a bit spartan looking, better lighting would change it from the clinical look to more plush, although the bathrooms without bathtubs but rather with a spacious shower are a nice touch. It always take a while to check out â€“ a drop off box for express checkout would be so desirable. Rooms at the front of the hotel have a great view of the train station clock but .... also a sound of trains, more so than at the back,

Reviews.Title: “Close to Central station, good value, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sebel quite often for work - it's a perfect business hotel if you are down that end of town and excellent value. Close to Central station and China Town - it's a little out of the way if you prefer the Harbour Bridge end of town. The rooms are very nicely decorated and the bathrooms I've had have been lovely. My only constructive criticism is that the rooms have often been far too warm and the thermostat adjustment doesn't work very well (I do prefer a cool room - less than 23 degs). Apart from that, the Sebel is clean, quite upmarket/swish and the staff are very welcoming and helpful - it's a good place to stay in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and close to Central Station for interstate travel”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin P
Reviews.Content: I found my 3 night stay at the Sebel in Surry Hills very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, with the one problem that I had with the air conditioning not cooling the room I was moved to a bigger better room. The room was spacious and pleasant. The location, near Central Station, was perfect for what I wanted and the food was very well priced for the quality of the food. The pool and gym areas were clean and not to dated in style.

Reviews.Title: “bad bed”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: Compared with the hotels in the uk, we found that the room was ok up to a 3*.. The bed was lumpy and it sank in the middle. The bath room needed updating.. The grouting around the bath was black with mould and needed re-grouting. I sat on the loo and cleaned a small patch with toilet paper and you could tell where It had cleaned so just a good clean would make it better. The bathroom door had been patched and patched and patched - it needed a new one. Lighting was poor. The room needs moor lights Apart from all this the hotel was central and ok. The staff we all nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, & in a Very Handy Location.”
Reviews.Author: rbro6610
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at the Sebel in Surry Hills very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful, the bed was excellent for sleeping in. The room was spacious and pleasant. The location, near Central Station, was perfect for what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Shenelle M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights, along with my aunt and uncle. We had our own rooms. Originally my partner and I were in a cheaper room on a lower floor, when we checked in staff were really nice and upgraded my room so my partner and I could be next door to my aunt and uncle and have the nicer room for the same rate we were originally paying. This gave me a very positive feeling about the hotel right from the start! The rooms were large and comfortable and very tidy! I felt like I was perhaps getting ALOT more than I paid for. My partner and I also took full advantage of the room service which was amazing. The food was delicious, no complaints! The swimming pool, spa and sauna were great. However when we went swimming we were expecting some clean fresh towels to be there... but were mistaken. We also had complimentary breakfast each morning we were there which was really good! The food was not cheap and nasty. The only negative thing I have to say about it was the disappointment with the fish tank in the main foyer. It was very dirty and not very nice compared to the photos on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and a good location”
Reviews.Author: fenflyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't have much of a grand entrance but the rooms make up for it. Large and well decorated with an enormous bed, large desk, sofa and coffee table it came close to being a suite and this was the cheapest room. The bathroom was exemplary it was actually a spacious wet room with a really good shower. Reception staff were charming and helpful and both checkin and out were carried out with the minimum of fuss. The hotel is close to Central Station so there are good transport links to the whole of the area. Surry Hills has lots to recommend it to foodies with interesting cafes, restaurants and delis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LucyOrangeNSW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mum for two nights. The location is great, its within walking distance to Central station, Darling Harbour and the City Centre. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and well maintained and the pool was also well kept and stocked with lots of fresh towells. Breakfast was good value for money with a variety of different selections on offer at the buffet. I will definietly be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: Phil T
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in March with a special package - breakfast, parking and museum tickets and transport. Great value: very close to Capital Theatre, SCG and easy access to buses for shopping. Check in was easy and staff excellent. Room was neat and tidy, though a little dated with marks on the wall but overall pleasing. Lifts fast and not crowded. Room swipes worked every time too! Breakfast was great - all 3 - with the quality of all types. Service was friendly - but do get all the photos in the restaurant squared up!! It drove me crazy - ocd?? Most impressed with the friendliness of all staff - all went out of their way to speak and genuinely enquired as to what you had planned etc. When asked for help nothing was too much trouble. Pool/spa was clean with fresh towels. Will be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: kellyholland1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebel Surry Hills on the 25th January 2012 for its location to the Enmore Theatre, as we were seeing a band that night. Checkin was really easy. A very clean and comfortable room, lovely staff, very comfy beds (most important). We asked for (and were given at no extra charge) a late check out which we really appreciated after a late night out. Great spot for going to Newtown, public transport easy access etc, and we would definitely stay again. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: PurdeyNT
Reviews.Content: Recent overnight stay for work, in a standard room. Fantastic location just across the road from Central Station made both getting from the airport and around the city really easy. Room was very spacious, plenty of room to spread out. Gym was well equiped and all equipment working. Rather cool feature in reception was the in floor aquarium! Everything was clean & tidy and decor wasn't to old or dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebel on a weekend family package which included breakfast, a four park tourist pass, monorail day pass and parking. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great an easy walk down to chinatown and paddys market. The breakfast was good with a wide variety, the coffee was a bit iffy, but we ordered proper coffees. The kids loved the pool and we had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Reputation does not exceeds the Sebel Surry Hills”
Reviews.Author: ChloeL019
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and i booked to stay at the Sebel Surry Hills based on the reputation of the Sebel hotel chain. However when we got there we were less then pleased. While the staff were very attentive and helpful. The location was good in terms good access to public transport the area was a little run down. The room and hotel was well below par. The room, whilst having a vauge ressemblence to the pictures on the web, showed the scars of over use with patchy paint marks over the walls. The bed was ok but covers again showed this use. The room was serviced daily, the condition of the bathroom showed the years of use and to be honest was just gross, the clean must of been very relaxed as hair and ruibish were still on the floor on our return. The room was dated and as i said showed its use over time incredibly clearly, stains and as previously stated wall patch ups all over the room. The gym also was less to be desired. The buffet breakfast was okay not great. I certainly wouldnt recommend this hotel to any friends or family and we were incredibly disapointed with the room condition, towards the end we spent less and less time in it.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Property, technology dinosaurs”
Reviews.Author: kenyonsf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is roughly used and badly in need of refurbishment. I stayed one night for business. As another reviewer noted, the glass covered pool in the lobby is filthy and that same lack of care is evident throughout the hotel. From marks on walls to patched and damaged wood in the sauna, everywhere you look something is cracked or broken or in need of paint. My real problem, with this hotel is how very unfriendly it is to anyone who uses technology. First is the $22 a day internet charge, which I know a lot of short-sighted hotels still do. But then, there is no wifi (oh there is weak wifi in the lobby but guess what? they charge you again for it), so I have to hard wire my laptop but using my iPhone and iPad on wifi? Forget it. But wait, there's more! The real kicker came when I went down to use the business center. Not only are the computers not upgraded and warnings pop up every minute saying the system needs updating and the hard disk is almost full, but even if you paid the $22 for internet, that doesn't cover the business center! They wanted me to cough up another $5 for 30 mins access to the internet to print a boarding pass. Ridiculous. Service was okay and bed comfortable, but between the state of disrepair and the ignorant technology policies, in the future I would never stay here and suggest that you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great relaxed and helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: MissMotivated
Reviews.Content: I live in the local area and stayed at the Sebel one night while my home was being used as a venue for my partner's boys night, and I had a girls night out. I chose the Sebel because I regularly stay at Sebel hotels for work, and because of the location, perfect for going out in Surry Hills and of course close to home. The staff were excellent, very friendly, and quick to respond to any request. I stayed in one of the suite rooms, and it was large, with a dining table, lounge area and separate space for bedroom, like a big studio apartment minus kitchen. The bed was the standard very comfortable Sebel bed, and the shower was good and strong. Those are the two most important things in a hotel in my view! For those not local, I think this would be an excellent location if you want to be near central station or surry hills, which is where all the coolest bars and restaurants in Sydney are! It's quite basic, nothing flash, but a perfectly good and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - overpriced, badly maintained, poor service”
Reviews.Author: sjbur
Reviews.Content: We had the unfortunate experience of staying in this hotel as part of a conference. We had come from Four Points by Sheraton in Darling Harbour - which was amazing and substantially cheaper than the Sebel. Early check-in had been arranged for 8:30am with the hotel as part of the conference - on arrival we were told this was not available Room was big, but walls scuffed and generally dirty aged feel to it. Upon sitting in the room for a few moments regretting our decision to move from Four Points to be closer to the conference, we noticed extreme road noise coming from the street and train station below. I went to the window and realised that it was open about 1cm. I tried to no avail to close the window, it was bolted in place and I ended up cutting my hand slightly. I called reception about the noise and window and someone from maintenance came up - only to look at the window, say that is how they are here and the rooms are not sound-proof "per se". I demanded to speak to someone about changing rooms as every car that passed sounded like it was driving over the top of us. I also called Four Points to look at moving back there but unfortunately they were booked out (lucky people there). Spoke to reception who said they would send somebody up. 20 minutes, 25 minutes still no one. Called again - told he should be on his way. All the time I just sat in the room staring at the wall (no cable channels to speak of on the tv). Finally the person came to move our room which was on the entire other side of the hotel next to the indoor pool. It was quiet but still was tired and the bed looked and felt generally bad. The pillows also were not down or plush. The lifts in the hotel are old and decrepit. The carpets are old. Most of the staff speak in a strong European accent and are more interested in talking to one another rather than addressing you. Checkout and bag storage was also a mess. Finally we left with a real sour note to the otherwise wonderful time we had in Sydney. TIP - stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best around the CBD”
Reviews.Author: RobbedByCambridge
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! It's close to everything and I've always left happy in every possible way. You will not get better value for money regarding, price and location, it's second to none. Their bar fridge always has snacks, water & beer. The pool is located high in the building with a great view. It's quite large & relatively private too. I can't fault them :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome random pick”
Reviews.Author: nttravelbug
Reviews.Content: Received the booking via a gamble on Wotif. Fantastic result as we were not too fussed about the location as a stopover before going regional. Turned out to be very convenient as just up the road there is a free green CBD bus to Circular Quay and ferry to Luna Park which was my girl's wish. Cheap as chips full breakfast for $20. Buster the concierge wins employee of the year for the effort and kindness he showed. Managed to get us fantastic tickets to Annie despite our last minute request. We were mother and daughter and managed to book 2 x king single beds which is quite a rare combo. Would highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Average not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Ryancarter1986
Reviews.Content: Good hotel clean tidy , front of house abit stuck up and unhelpful and had but of attitude as we are young travellers I thought. Fully booked so cudnt check in earlier but offered changing room in pool area. Gym was good but breakfast prices were incredible expensive just walk 2 Sydney yha hostel for full Bfast at 1/2 the price. Good location to train station also

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: HW82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very handy to the Entertainment Centre where we were going which was great. It was clean, but on arrival our air conditioning was obviously not working. We went straight out and our air conditioning was still not working when we returned and a phone call to Reception only illicited a 'you need to wait and see' result. When they finally agreed to come and check it, they immediately realised it wasn't working (like we said) and they moved us into a different room. After this, there were no problems. Hotel was otherwise good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on fringe of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: agrimac
Reviews.Content: Very large room compared to hotels in Europe, with all amenities including flat screen TV. Pleasant and helpful front desk staff,but servicing of the rooms left much to be desired;bed making was very rough,face flannels were there one day but not the next, or there was only one instead of two. Still,overall, a pleasant stay at reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell890
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and how a year and better staff has made a difference. Last year's visit was just OK as the room we stayed in was tired and the staff didn't want to go out of their way to accommodate any requests. However this year was a total turn around. Staff, especially Buster, assisted with all our needs and the rooms looked to have had a revamp. Well done and thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, bad parking”
Reviews.Author: Mel P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a connivance meeting for 2 days. We couldnt get a park in their underneath parking even though we had 2 spaces included in 2 rooms we booked. One of the ladies went and asked about what do we do about this and they told us to double park. As she came back to tell us someone left so we took their park... I wouldnt have liked to have been the person closed in if we had to double park. Convance rooms were clean and tidy. Our morning tea and afternoon tea for 2 days was amazing but way to heavy for only ladies..... etc.... donuts and sausage rolls without sauce was to much. Breakfast and Lunch in the restaurant was fantastic. All toilets were clean. My room was fantastic although it did need maintenance in the bathroom and the air con vent rattled. Didnt get a good sleep due to the rattle.

Reviews.Title: “a modern closed box”
Reviews.Author: DinoA77
Reviews.Content: To stay here was convenient for meeting and room price was business booked. But it is a relatively soul-less place. Parking is useful, at modest price for inner city. Also readily accessible by train, including from airport. But we would never stay here for a private visit. The windows are sealed, the aircon is good but not choice of fresh air, not possible at this site. Beds comfy (multiple visits). Stay here if you want really efficient location to get in and get out. But not for any atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night”
Reviews.Author: Beefabee
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but just wanted to say the walls between the rooms need insulation of some type. Obviously the guest next door heard us come in a little late (as quiet as we thought we were being) and decided to turn his TV on full blast for an hour, then again at 7am!! I heard him have a laugh, a coughing fit, even make himself a coffee!!! So yes neighboring guest noise is a huge issue. If you're looking for a sleepin this isnt the place to do it. Our bathroom had a lot of soap scum on the tiles too. Breakfast was lovely though!

Reviews.Title: “Better since the renovations”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times in the past but not for quite a few years. It appears to have been renovated and is significantly better now. The 8th floor room was very good with a very comfortable bed and all amenities. The bathrooms had clearly had a make-over with new taps, vanities and fittings. All areas of the hotel appeared clean and well maintained. Staff at reception were fast, attentive and generally excellent - one of the best hotels for service in recent memory. While I didn't use the pool, gym or restaurant, they all seemed to be in excellent order. Public areas were fine. There were a large number of groups staying at the time (Chinese New Year) but everything was smooth and trouble free. Only drawback is that the hotel is a 15 minute walk to the central part of CBD (but conversely only 300 metres to Central Station)

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: DazBGerringong
Reviews.Content: The family & I stayed at the hotel over the Australia day long weekend. We got an incredible deal through wotif that included the room, carparking & breakfast with the kids free, for ~ half the normal rate. The hotel is in a good location & easy walk to central station, chinatown, entertainment centre, powerhouse museum & southern end of darling harbour. The free 555 shuttle bus will get you up to the harbour end for nothing during the day. Having said that the room we had (No. 711) was pretty average and maybe this was because we got the special rate. It wasn't large by any means, the view out the window was of a brick wall. It had everything you'd expect in a city hotel, but nothing special to make it a 4.5 star and just looked tired in general . The bathroom was the big letdown with mouldy broken floor & wall tiles, some big enough to put your finger into, which is not good when you've got 2 young kids staying in the room with you. This was more 2 star standard. The breakfasts were great however and so were the staff and the kids loved the indoor heated pool. Overall, its a good place to use as a base to explore the city. If it wasn't for the special price, I don't know if I'd stay there again (not in 711 anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. great location, great service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: LizzyLeeton
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned after reading some not so flattering reviews but we had an incredible experience. We got a great deal which included a tremendous breakfast for two and the room was spacious, clean, quiet and with a view. Best of all though was the service. I loved the way staff acknowledged you when you were walking about, the check in and out was quick, friendly and professional and nothing was too much trouble. At one stage I was waiting in the lobby and I watched the Concierge in action and he was great. He made everyone feel welcome and as though you were the most important person in the world. This a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to the city”
Reviews.Author: Henry Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room, very large. loved the king bed, The staff were very friendly they let us put our car in their carpark 4 hours early. Best breakfast, had an onelet station which is usually in 5 star hotels also the continental section was one of the best I've seen. Will recommend the hotel to my associates for conferences in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry not nice”
Reviews.Author: Iammadabouttravel
Reviews.Content: I found the reception staff weren't very nice. The photos of the room looked lovely when I booked, Very disappointed. The room smelt very musky & damp. The floor was soaking wet. Couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: skaps21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with friends at the start of our Australian trip. For the price, and the location, the hotel is a good option. It's a 5 minute walk to Central Station, 10-15 mins to Chinatown, and 20+ into the central business district. The rooms are fine, we had no issues, and they're big enough to accommodate a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but rooms are looking dated”
Reviews.Author: Haz89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we had to attend a friend's birthday party.. We booked a studio room which was average. The room had a lot of marks on the walls which I think is from suitcase scratches... Service at check in and breakfast was good. The breakfast food was yummy and had plenty of variety.. It is in a handy location and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Stay”
Reviews.Author: richam6364
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel late (between Christmas & New Year) for a New Years Eve stay 2011/2012 mainly because it was one of the few hotels who hadn't jacked up their standard room rates nor did they insist on you booking a minimum of three nights. The hotel was conveniently located near Central Station. The room was clean & well appointed and although we had the room right next to the lift well, we were not disturbed at all by any lift noise. The hotel desk staff at check in and departure, were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PJH141
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Sebel Surry Hills and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location with Central train station and buses close by. The reception staff were very friendly & helpful as were the breakfast buffet staff. Our room was very spacious and clean, with a daily change of clean towels & our comfortable beds remade. We were on the 3rd floor and hardly heard any noise from the street or from the other rooms. Swimming pool, sauna & spa was great especially after a long day out! All in all it's an excellent hotel to stay at, we will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: themudgeerambler
Reviews.Content: Close to Central railway station and a short walk to the vibrant eating/drinking areas of Surry Hills. To get into the CBD of Sydney it is about a 20 minute walk. We walked from here down to the Art Gallery going via the lovely Hyde Park. If you dont want to walk that far get the hotel to arrange a cab or walk across to Central and catch a train or bus. The hotel itself is clean and the staff are helpful. There is a pool although except fr the morning we departed it was closed. There is a restuarant there but there are so many great places close by it would be a shame not to try some of them- Le Monde in Faveaux St for breakfast or lunch, House or Bird Cow Fish or Billy Kwong., Longrain, red Lantern, Portena the list is long. Some are at the dearer end so choose carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Very quite place, very spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: VictorEvchatov
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated far from noisy overcrowded streets. Very spacious rooms, my room 409 was about 40 sq m. Situated is very close to Central Station. A bus stop within 5 min walking to Bondi Beach. No free Wi-fi. Very helpful & friedly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well-staffed”
Reviews.Author: deejay17
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Sebel Surry Hills and could not fault the Staff or the accommodation in which I stayed. The position is convenient to Central Station, Chinatown, and the free 555 city loop bus which goes up as far as Circular Quay. Bed linen and towels were changed daily and domestic staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a noisy room”
Reviews.Author: MustangMatty
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a few times at the Sebel (and under its previous names). It's certainly in a handy location, and its lower price than many of its CBD competitors is a plus. Parking is OK, usual CBD cost of $32 per night. Great pool and good in-house dining options. Unfortunately on this stay, we got a room that seemed to have a lot of noise. Some of this seemed to be street noise (were facing Mary St) but also quite a bit of internal noise, unsure of whether it was plumbing or neighbour noise. Never experienced it before here. Otherwise, the rooms were spacious enough, with a palatial king size bed. I'd probably consider staying again, but would stay somewhere else if the price and location were comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcomed extra guest”
Reviews.Author: mitp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sebel for 2 nights and it was our first time staying there. The reception staff looked frantic when they greeted us (to be fair, they said that they just had a bus load of people came through). We especially didn't like the "extra" guest (cockroach) who was happy to be lurking on the wall and it took 30 minutes for someone to come to the room and finally realized that a broom and dust pan wouldn't work as it needed a good spray! We won't be staying there again not only of the extra guest, but our bed was so uncomfortable and housekeeping was below standard that weekend. The only good thing is that the train station is near.

Reviews.Title: “Very very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: scash80
Reviews.Content: Good location next to Central train station. A neat underground car park (30 extra dollars a day though). A nice spa and pool which was open till 10pm. Big room. Big TV. Nice bed. Excellent bathroom. The reception staff were a little bit grumpy - I don't like pointing that out but feel like its my duty to be honest!! I would stay here again though. I didn't have breakfast here though as a hot breakfast was 30 bucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Blimey.

Reviews.Title: “Run down”
Reviews.Author: KBalson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sebel Surry Hills before and found the service and room quality fine. On this stay (7 nights) I have really noticed how run down the hotel is and how lax the staff are. The room I am staying in is just badly designed; for example there is nowhere to plug in a phone charger or laptop except at the desk, which is laid out such that you can only sit 1/2m away from the charger - i.e. you cannot sit and use your phone if on a normal length charger. The bathroom door opens into the shower rail and has a big hole in it from years of doing so. The hallway smells strongly of smoke (the hotel is non smoking). Housekeeping simply chose to ignore my dry cleaning for two days. For someone who is staying on business, this hotel is fairly well located and will offer the basics, but not a place to look forward coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Quality & value”
Reviews.Author: KandTCanberra
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to this hotel and it was a great experience. Very helpful, smiling staff at reception with advice on parking etc. Rooms large, clean, modern and well maintained - everything worked (including the safe). Breakfasts were first class in exceptionally pleasant room with no shortage of newspapers. Location is of course excellent - especially with the free CBD shuttle bus stopping 100 metres away. Easy walk to a host of restaurants on Crown St. Very good value (we had picked up a special online deal well in advance). And finally, no surprises at check-out is always a plus! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Sebel Surry Hills Sydney”
Reviews.Author: karen b
Reviews.Content: Last month I Stayed at this hotel, and as per previous visits was very satisfied and impressed. I loved my room with a bath, the decaf coffee, the sauna, the friendliness of staff and the little extra touches like the robe for the pools, the lock feature on the back of the door, the in-room safe. The staff really went the extra mile, escorting me to Central station at 4:30 am! Thanks everyone. I recommend this hotel to any woman travelling alone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, I highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Robyn5373
Reviews.Content: My husand, 2yo daughter and I stayed at the Sebel Surry Hills for 4 nights. We had the Family Explorer Package for 2 nights which was fantastic and saved us a fortune. We had breakfast daily which was great. The room was nice and clean and the staff were all fantastic. Our little girl loved the fish below the floor. Location wise this hotel is great being only about 200 meters from Central Train Station and walkable distance to most places anyway. We were in room 812 and although we could hear the trains when there was no tv on, it wasn't loud or annoying. If we go back to Sydney, we will definately stay here. It is an excellent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to great restaurants and pubs.”
Reviews.Author: saslb
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival by airport train to Central Station it is a very easy walk of 600 metres to the hotel from the train station. A free shuttle bus circulates to Circular Quay and stops about 100 metres from the hotel. We used this service to get around Sydney, it was so easy and convenient. Staff were friendly and accommodating to our requests during our stay, beds were good and a few different pillow types to choose from is always good. If I had any complaint it would only be the water pressure in the shower, it was a little low for my liking, but that is being very pickie. All in all a good hotel for a good price in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Sebel brand isn't what it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPeteShow
Reviews.Content: There's a coffee table book in the rooms at the sebel in Surry Hills, reminiscing on the glory days of the now closed Sebel Townhouse on Elizabeth Bay. It talks about how it was the place to be seen in Sydney - a popular gathering point for those who liked a fun atmosphere. But there isn't much in the way of atmosphere at the Surry Hills venue. The rooms are large but rather stark. The furnishings are modern and uninteresting. The beds are comfortable enough. The staff are polite and efficient. Many reviews have described the noisiness of the location - but from my room on the 7th floor, it wasn't a probelm at all. The main benefit of the Sebel is its location, if you're doing business in the Surry Hills/Central Station end of town. It's an easy five minute walk from the station - which provides a fantastic, cheap option for transport to and from the airport. No need for cabs at all. In short, it's an adequate place to stay - but nothing interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: cottondownunder
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Expensive for the quality you get. I'd rate it more 2/3 *** at apush.

Reviews.Title: “Not as flash as I would have expected”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sebel Surry Hills for 2 nights in late November 2011. Upon entering room 712 I looked out the window and there was a fantastic view of Central Station. Well, all I can positive about the room and hotel was that. The guests above the room (I believe to be 812) arrived at approx. 9.00 pm and were constantly banging their feet and jumping on the floor for 2 hours. Perhaps they were dancing or decided to annoy the guest in my room. After 10.00 pm I could hear the traffic downstairs honking their horn every now and then and I went outside the hotel to see what was going on and there was a car parked on the left side of Albion St facing towards the hotel (Oxford St). I can't believe somebody would simply park their car in far left lane where there is clearly a No Parking Sign and traffic could not get through. I advised reception who said they will notify the Police. 2 hours later the honking still continued. In the morning after breakfast I went outside and would you believe the car is still there and cars had to go around it still honking their horns. I went out for the entire day and upon my return after 6.00 pm, you guessed it, the car was still parked there! I thought I can't put up with horns honking for the entire night. Anyway, I went to my room tried to ignore the honks by watching tv and by 10.30 pm I couldn't sleep because I knew in my mind I was expecting honks! And yes, there were honks! By 1.00 am I was still awake. I eventually fell asleep and after breakfast I went to check if the car was still parked there and to my amazement it was gone. I was expecting it to still be there and was (sad to say this), hoping it was so somebody else could put up with what I had to. The Sebel it definitely not a quite hotel and with the traffic at the corner of Elizabeth and Albion St you will not get a good night's rest. Perhaps you should consider another hotel like the Travelodge located at the corner of Wentworth and Goulburn Sts which I have stayed at twice before and never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Week-end”
Reviews.Author: ReidyNSW
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel when it had an advertised special room sale so the cost was quite reasonable, having stayed in Sydney regularly over many years we didn't realise this hotel existed until the last week-end. We found the reception staff to be very friendly and helpful and the staff in the buffet breakfast were terrific, really one of the friendlier more helpful staff we've found. Not sure what other reviewers have found to complain about but we had a deluxe room that was spacious, everything looked quite new and the bed was really comfortable. There was a little noise from the sirens up and down Elizabeth Streeet but otherwise it was reasonably quiet. The location is great, really close to Central, Crown Steet food establishments, a shortt walk to the city or buses just around rhe corner. We were pretty impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Please finish the refurbishment of the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: boiaboiawaga
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a "deluxe" room Entering the room, new tiles have been laid on the floor through to the bathroom (which has also been extensively and well refurbished in modern fittings), but that's where it ends. In contrast to the entry and the bathroom, the carpet on the floor in the remainder of the room is probably 5 years past its use by date and urgently requires replacement. The paint on the walls is heavily marked and is in need of repainting. The desk and associated furniture has a black painted finish which is very chipped and well worn. The "old versus new" fitout of the room is quite stark and, in my opinion, requires immediate attention The remainder of the hotel has been refurbished and presents extremely well. Had breakfast each morning which is typical **** hotel fare. Staff are professional and helpful, but I did need to chase down the cleaning staff each day to have my bathroom essentials replaced This is my fourth stay at this hotel and I will stay again due to the location and pricing, but it would be nice to see the remainder of the room refurbished to the standard of the common areas of the hotel and the bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in November 2011. Fast and friendly check in. Rooms large and comfortable, great bed and quiet room. Staff were fantastic, went out of their way to make sure we new about the free bus service, advise on best places to go etc. Top marks to all staff. Breakfast was excellent, well presented and a variety of foods. Walking distance to China town and Central Railway and down to Darling Harbour. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Karina1912
Reviews.Content: The pictures are a lot better than the actual room. My room was a bit tired looking and very small. I travel a lot for work in fact I am away almost every week and so I was quite disappointed when I walked into this room for a girls night out in the city. Had I known it was going to be like this, I could have paid less money and chosen the Kirketon Hotel or something else.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Les Q
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 4/5 star Hotels around the world and can, without hesitation, say that the Sebel in Surry Hills Sydney is equal to the best, for location and comfort. I find the hotel easy to walk to from Central Railway and the CBD. I can always get a taxi or bus from out front or nearby if necessary and I have never had to worry about my car with parking available. The staff are always friendly and the rooms always clean and regularly updated with new colour schemes and decor. There are abundant eating locations a short walk away and so too theatres and nightspots. I have stayed at the Sebel with my children who have had hours of fun in the pool and gym. I have no hesitating The Sebel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good value ... noisy room”
Reviews.Author: PerthTraveveller22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sebel for one night on a business trip. I was checked into room 902, which is near the lifts and has an interconnecting door to the room next door. Initially everything was fine ... the furnishings are nice, the bathroom is modern and clean - as I would expect from a good hotel. About 11pm someone moved in next door and I realised that we had a single internal interconnecting door without any sound proofing between us. I could hear next door's suitcase locks snap open (!), as well as every word of his telephone conversation, the TV, the water running in the shower etc. In addition, the neighbouring building's very noisy airconditioning units are on a roof top just outside the rooms on this side/level of the hotel. All in all - I had a very restless start of the night. I provided my feedback to reception the next morning and they seemed to suggest that they would have moved me ... however at 11pm at night that wouldn't have been an attractive option either. When you book here ensure you ask for a QUIET room and avoid any with an interconnecting door. I ordered room service for dinner and it was by far the worst room service meal I have ever had. The Butter Chicken arrived in a thin, runny and oily (not thick and creamy as you would expect) sauce. The rice was warm in some parts and cold in others. The quantity was small and consistet of mainly rice with a few bits of chicken. You pay for the dish as well as a standard $4.- tray charge - regardless of the overall value of the order - , which makes it quite an expensive option. Don't bother with room service!

Reviews.Title: “Not Four and a half stars”
Reviews.Author: Countrybloke_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights on a package deal. It was rated foru and a half stars but that is being very generous. While our room was clean and confortable it was definatly not "deluxe" when you compare it to other hotels of a similar rating. For example there was only a tiny wardrobe for hanging and no drawers for clothing and other items. It is situated in a fairly dodgy part of Sydney but that is offset by being only a couple of minutes walk from Central Railway Station. The staff were very friendly and obliging and breakfast in the restaurant was pleasant. In summary a nice enough place but if you are looking for a little bit of luxury, look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: spikey2
Reviews.Content: on a recent trip to Sydney we needed something in Surry Hills. The Sebel fits the bill. Central, walking distance from the railway station, Hyde Park, the Opera House. Close to Oxford street ... I could go on. Very friendly staff, clean bright rooms. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: dramaticAuckland
Reviews.Content: The location and extremely helpful staff makes up for the disappointing rooms with a real concrete wall feel. We paid for a deluxe room and it was very basic so I would hate to see non deluxe. Bathrooms nice and modern but room lacked some character, mainly due to one big concrete wall. Walking distance to lots of Sydney's attractions and right opposite central train station. Slept ok. If you just want a bed in a great location, its well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Sebel - Surrey Hills Sydney - Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Prellyan
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out the service was excellent. The staff were aware of the local area and made great suggestions on what was around for coffee and services such as tailoring. Very friendly atmosphere whilst remaining highly professional and the presentation of the hotel and staff was great. Breakfast was a comprehensive selection of well prepared and presented food. Rooms were very clean and well presented with exceptionally comfortable beds. The pool and spa area was clean and safe and a welcome break. Overall a friendly welcoming establishment with a modern refurbishment and feel. An easy walk to Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the city with plenty to see along the way and places to have a rest with coffee. Close to the Crown Street cafes as well as a plethora of places in the immediate surrounds. Thanks for letting me play your piano.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle H
Reviews.Content: Nothing was too much trouble from the staff at this hotel. The rooms were lovely, the meals fantastic and the location perfectly suited our needs. we got this hotel from a deal with wotif.com and we were thrilled to bits. When travelling with toddlers its the little things that matter, they really go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. They gave our son and my niece a teddy bear, which they loved. We cant recommend this hotel enough. Thankyou for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good As A Backup”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last April during a particularly busy weekend when many hotels were booked out. Not really much wrong with this hotel at all. Rooms a bit smallish, but nicely renovated and clean. Very friendly, helpful staff, and pretty good location close to Central Station. Only real problem, is that for the money, there are other hotels that are that little bit nicer, in a bit better location. This hotel would not be my first, second, or even third choice, but if other hotels in CBD are sold out, this would be a very reasonable backup.

Reviews.Title: “GOT A GREAT DEAL IN A GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: moniethebest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a long weekend from the Gold Coast. We booked through wotif's mystery deal so didn't know what hotel we would be staying at until we paid for it. We got there at 11:30pm and loved the fact that they had 24 hr check in. Is nice and close to central station so very easy from the airport. The staff were so lovely and accommodating. The room was nice, modern furnishings. Couldn't hear any noise from the busy street below. For the money we paid we were more than happy with the hotel and would happily recommend it again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great staff, and Great location”
Reviews.Author: wend0100
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times with my husband over the past 2 years and this time just as enjoyable as previous visits. We had a special deal which included brekky and parking allowing us to spoil ourselves for a great price. The location for us is spot on and have never found it to be a problem as it is just a 3 minute walk to George Street and then on to Darling Harbour & the city centre but then again we don't mind walking!! The rooms have always been clean with good comfy beds and we have been upgraded on several occasions to a suite type which are even more spacious. The staff are always pleasant and very helpful and in particular should mention on this occasion Ian checked us in very smoothly and went out of his way to accomodate us. The breakfast is more than adequate too. Re the noise as mentioned by some fellow advisors we have never found it to be a real problem and I am a very light sleeper, also remember you are in a busy city and close to Central station!! Looking forward to our next stay in a few weeks time!!

Reviews.Title: “i keep coming back so it must be good”
Reviews.Author: ROBYN3614
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the last 15 years, the location is excellent, Central Station and Darling Harbour are a short walk away, Circular Quay and the Rocks are a 50 minute walk or a short bus ride away. The rooms are always clean, the staff are always pleasant and helpful, and breakfast is pretty good . My only complaint is the sauna/spa are out of order more times than they are working. I nearly forgot to say beds are soooo comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ozvpm_andy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business in Sept 2011. Overall, this was a pleasant enough hotel to stay in - located very close to Central Station and only a short walk into the city centre (fyi it is about 4kms to Circular Quay) I arrived ewarly and my room was not yet ready. the check in and check out process were both handled very efficiently and the staff were excellent The rooms were nothing out of the ordinary, but clean and comfortable. The only slight negative experience I had was that there was no milk in my mini bar for coffee. Oh and of course there was no free internet, always my big bug bear with any hotel you are paying $170+ a night for Breakfast was excellent and the restaurant really quite lovely I'd certainly consider staying again

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and close to central station”
Reviews.Author: Kaylana
Reviews.Content: My room on the 5th floor was very spacious and comfortable. It was well laid out and not at all pokey. Plently of room to put luggage, sit on the couch, etc. The bathroom was very clean and well maintained also. No mould, smells, stains. The location is a little out of the centre of the city which could be viewed as both good and bad. It's about 10-15 mins walk into the heart of town. You can definately find a compatible hotel closer in to the action and the sights. It is close to Central Statiom though.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business”
Reviews.Author: TravHar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is mid-range. Good air-conditioning and comfortable bed, great staff. Great location for business in the upper part of the city. But Internet is EXTREMELY poor. I last stayed here in March 2011. Staff advised that the internet was undergoing an upgrade. 6 months later it is no better, perhaps worse. I get timeouts downloading text emails! Doing any real online work is impossible. If you expect any sort of internet connectivity, DO NOT stay at this hotel. Bathroom is ok, but shower is in the bath, if you can suffer with that? Summary: Friendly staff and satisfactory rooms, but internet is basically useless.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: JimmyD_8
Reviews.Content: On getting to my room, i noticed a very strong smell. Having booked quite cheaply on wotif.com, I thought i got the left overs. However, they moved me immediately and upgraded me. The rooms were very plain. However the standout feature was the staff- friendly and attentive. I think care is needed before booking this hote. First, it is very close to central station which is great. On the other hand, its location is right on the edge of the CBD. If this us your first time in Sydney, definitely do not book as there are many better locations but for regular visitors who know their way around it may be a cheaper alternative to many of the expensive places in the Rocks and Circular Quay

Reviews.Title: “Not worth. Not coming back.”
Reviews.Author: RobbieIlaria
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night only. I moved to another hotel. No soul at all. The carpet in lift area was new but looked like 1980s. The room was not clean. The bed not comfortable. But especially the noise coming from the busy Elizabeth street was just disturbing and never ending. What about spending some money in some sound proof windows? Cannot say about the staff as i barely met them. They seemed efficient anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient location with friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jandjrey
Reviews.Content: From the first greeting we felt like valued customers The room was nice, clean and spacious. The location was really great and located near to the CBD, Chinatown etc. We got a special deal so made it a fantastic treat at a great price. It is so close to Central Station that you can hear the trains though its not overly noisy. I just popped in my gel ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Average place, crap bed”
Reviews.Author: samb1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business after getting a half price deal through a website. Close to Central Station and there are some good bars/restaurants/architecture in the neighbourhood. Building is quite tired and uninspiring, and the rooms were average at best- very nondescript. Internet was really poor- 8 dollars an hour and couldn't log in and out- which meant that i had to spend $16 to check emails for 10 minutes in 2 hours. The business centre was ok- free printing at least. Breakfast was passable- usual options, average black coffee, had to pay for a proper coffee. Quite nice yoghurt and ok pancakes. low point for me was the bed and pillow- ultra soft bed that sloped to one side, and ultra soft pillows that provided no support. Combined with the street noise i only managed a couple of hours sleep. Plus side- the service was ok. Much better options around for the full price- and probably better options around for the reduced price i got!

Reviews.Title: “Very Central and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: luckygirlcairns
Reviews.Content: I would consider this hotel good value for money. The rooms are confortable, quiet and can be made quite dark when sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Great Location; Heavenly Beds”
Reviews.Author: travellingducks
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews of this place are a puzzle. I'm not sure whether there's two classes of rooms in this place but we have just had our 5th visit in 2-3 years and we just can't find a better option for our Sydney trips. The location is brilliant - you are within easy walking distance of Central Station (trains to anywhere); Chinatown and Darling Harbour; the Capitol Theatre; the shoppers (my wife and kids) can be in David Jones on Elizabeth St in 20 mins. Walk to Hyde Park. Up the hill and you're in Crown Street for all the yummy food and nice pubs. Back to the hotel. The pillow matresses are to die for !!!! I don't sleep well when I travel ..... but here I just sleep deeply!. The decor is modern; the rooms are well immuned from the city noise (we did have an Albion St facing room once and the traffic noise was noticeable). And with great friendly staff, why would you stay anywhere else if you need to be in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: prissy74
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for one night on our way to New Zealand and were very disappointed with the room we were given.We had stayed at the Sebel Surry Hills two times before but had never been put in such a sub standard room as we did this time.It felt like we were shoved in a room that had wet carpet,bubbling paint and was unfinished even though the refurbishment was meant to have been done in 2009 all because I had gotten a special online.It was very upsetting at the time and I contacted the hotel but never got a response so I took it that they don't really care.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: AdeleF
Reviews.Content: Good location was the best thing I could say about this hotel. While it is clean and moderately comfortable, the rooms are soul-less and devoid of many comforts and features that should be standard. My strongest negative was that so many things didn't work - it was becoming almost comical in the end. The TV, the (non-existent but advertised) safe in the room, the inaccessible though heavily promoted swimming pool. Every piece of equipment I tried in the gym - no wonder it was deserted. The computers probably worked but I was amazed there was a charge to use them as I was there for a conference. There was also a charge for WiFi - standard in much less expensive accom. places. Breakfast in the restaurant was very basic, as were other meals. However the service was friendly and the hotel was reasonable value given its location close to Central Station (if you're not going to travel by trains, the location wouldn't be a plus).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and to a good standard”
Reviews.Author: Crawley86
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using a Wotif Wotdeal so was happy to stay at the Sebel Surry Hills as I had never stayed there before. In fact, I usually aim to stay closer to the centre of Sydney. Driving into the hotel, the driveway was crowded but that was due to idiots in rental cars and not the hotel. The car park wasnâ€™t too tight but was very full also. Entering the lobby, you got a feeling that it was going to be of a relatively decent standard for its rating. The staff were extremely friendly and I got my room key quite quickly. Moving to my room, I got the feeling that the hotel was split in 2 as the lifts to my room were down the bottom of the lobby yet a lot of guests were getting into lifts at the top. The room was a good size and had everything I wanted for a 1 night stay. The bed was comfortable despite it being 2 single beds stuck together (which so many hotels seem to do). The couch was comfortable and the desk a good size to use my laptop. I was only on level 3 and had a view of the street looking down to Central Station. The bathroom was clean buy clearly starting to date. The door was chipping as were some of the tiles. The shower was in the bath which I have grown to despise in my travels. But the location was great. I had been encouraged to explore Surry Hills yet didnâ€™t get a chance on this trip so am not sure of its proximity to all these great cafes and bars I have heard about. But it was only a few minute walk to Central Station which was where I needed to go. I also walked down the China Town which was extremely close. I had the hotel breakfast which was offered to me at a discounted rate where I pre-purchased. It had all the essentials and even the scrambled eggs werenâ€™t runny (yet I am yet to find a hotel to make the taste good). It had one of those pancake making boxes which seemed to provide a level of entertainment to younger guests. Overall, I will go back to this hotel in the future. Granted I got it at a very cheap price but it was at a good experience and will hopefully enable me to explore Surry Hills in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Angela214
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Sebel. Fast check-in, under 5 mins! The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was clean though some of the tiles looked a little dated, cracked etc, but they were clean so that is the main thing! Bed was super comfy with lots of pillows and cushions. Breakfast was okay, bacon, eggs, sausages, hash browns, tomatoes, cereal, toast, pancakes, fresh fruit and yoghurt. Wasn't the best I have seen but filling enough. We had breakfast included in the room, not sure I would pay $23 for it. It is about a 15 min walk to the main area of George Street, only 5 mins to Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to get around Sydney”
Reviews.Author: EkochDDS
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a good experience at the Sebel. The 3 people that I can mention by name whom made our stay pleasant were Nigel, Buster, and Steph. There were others as well. Nigel was extremely helpful in booking activities for my family and I. The heater in our room did not work so they supplied a small heater which worked quite well. They offered to move us to another room but we declined since we had two adjoining rooms. Bathrooms, tubs and vents could use some cleaning. Breakfast was good but since we stayed for 5 nights it would have been nice to have had a little more variety. My kids loved the pancake machine and wanted to bring it home.

Reviews.Title: “A generally awful experience”
Reviews.Author: cmmherbert
Reviews.Content: The hotel was busy at the time we arrived, and so despite a check in time of 2pm we were unable to access our room until 6pm, once an hour being told that the room would be ready in 10-15 minutes. The bathroom had mould in the corners nearest the shower, and there was no fitting covering the hole in the wall where the showerhead emerges. We purchased internet for $84 for out 7 days stay, and arrived to find a single wired ethernet port that was exceptionally slow, only one person could use it at a time, and there was no wireless available in the suites. Upon check-out 2 other members of the room were charged for the full 7 days worth of internet despite no previous indication that the single connection was available for only one persons use. The buffet breakfast lacks variety, and certainly isn't worth the $20 they charge for it. The rooms are freezing cold, and though the airconditioning can be set to more than 22 degrees C, the temperature won't actually get up to more than 15. The staff, with the exception of a rather awful manager named "Luke" are pleasant and very helpful (Luke is the antithesis of helpful), and the facilities are good. There are many other hotels in Sydney, and I would look elsewhere before booking this one - it's at the lower end of quality & service for its price point, and a better experience could be had elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice fishtank, but needs some improvement”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: First things first: this hotel has a famous underfloor fishtank in the lobby. Yes, it is cool. Now, down to business. It's in a good location, a short walk from Central Station in one direction and from the cool eateries and bars of Crown Street in the other direction. Service was efficient, if not warm. But I can live with that. The room (deluxe) seems to have been recently redecorated and the furniture feels fresh. The bed is comfortable. The room is quiet despite the railway proximity. The bathroom lets it down, with it's tired shower-over-the-bath affair. But it's not a big problem. What is a problem for me in this room (917) is the wiring for the lights. It is not possible to have the bedside lights on without having a main overhead light on in the entry foyer. This is an incredibly annoying and stupid design. I also could have done without the cleaners' hairs in the bathtub and on the throw at the end of the bed. Please, please, can hotel chambermaids start wearing nets when they clean bathrooms and make beds? It really grosses me out to come across those long hairs. Then there is the breakfast room. It looks and feels like a giant pig troff or food hall from a low brow suburban shopping mall. I took one look and left (plenty of more interesting breakfast places around Crown Street). Broadband internet is available at an absurdly unreasonable price, as it is in most Australian establishments that consider themselves to be upmarket but which are sadly out of step with the rest of the world on this issue. Overall, the hotel is a bit too big for my liking. The winding corridors feel like a rabbit warren. On balance, I don't think this hotel is a four star property (as self-rated by the operators), and nor it it a worthy successor to the Sebel name, having 'replaced' the famous Sebel Town House which must be remembered now as one of the world's first true hip boutique hotels. It's okay. It's nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: kensa77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in Sydney for the State of Origin. Hotel is in a very handy location to Central Railway Station which was perfect for us. Check in was quick and efficient. No problems at all. Room is a little boring, but nice and clean. Quite big, comfortable bed, flatscreen TV on wall. Not many channels to choose. Bathroom a decent size. Overall just an average hotel. Great location if you need to be near the train line.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: eve16
Reviews.Content: Good average hotel. Don't expect fast service, although staff are generally helpful. Clean rooms, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to trains & pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: Kakiteano
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a course/conference on-site. Can't comment on value for money as hotel was included as part of course. Front desk staff were helpful with directions and suggestions. Pros: Spacious room. Comfortable bed. Generous breakfast. Central station across the road so handy for trains around Sydney including to airport. Helpful staff. Great restaurant nearby (Assiette). Comfortable desk and chair in room so could do work. Cons: Arrived on a Sunday night, and restaurant not open, so had to eat at Townhouse sports bar attached to hotel. Spa not working while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: sydneyc10
Reviews.Content: I booked this via wotif's mystery deal and after reading the TripAdvisor reviews was dreading my stay. However, I was very pleasantly surprised. All the staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful, I was upgraded and they allowed me to check in very early and leave late with no problems at all. Room service was prompt and good, the room was spotless if a little boring - but had everything I needed, including tea/coffee facilities which I appreciated. They do desperately need to repaint the hotel room doors, and as others have commented the floor aquarium is a little underwhelming, but these are minor aesthetic problems. The location is also very handy for business & leisure. Overall I had a brilliant stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK a bit too tired”
Reviews.Author: James124124
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the newish bathrooms are good, but the rest of the room is so tired. The walls are painted plain white and our particular room had patch marks all over the wall in another shade of white where they had tried to cover up marks from other guests - very tacky indeed. Beds are very old, furniture probably even looked old when the Sydney Olympics were on and the TV is some poor quality no name unit with very average picture quality. Breakfast was a simple affair, all OK but nothing great. Many of the electronic door locks are damaged and prone to not working that well - we had to asisst an elderly gentleman with his as the lights on the lock were all broken so he had no idea if the door was unlocking or not. Overall pretty ordinary and we wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly...”
Reviews.Author: PazzaB
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel, affable and close the personnel. Very much accessibility in city centre. Nearby all seats of entertainments and set of shops and cafe near to hotel

Reviews.Title: “look good but not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: eyepineapple
Reviews.Content: I stayed in twin bed room (#808). The beds were too small and not comfortable. I think the spring bed was too old so it caused backache after long sleep. The room was not clean well. When we arrived the room, the carpet was dirty with some snack.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: EJK80
Reviews.Content: Very new-looking hotel with great rooms. Big beds and pillow menu. Funky, modern bathroom. Helpful staff and lovely communal areas. Based in Surry Hills, so still close to the city (10-15min to Darling Harbour) and same distance to Crown St where there is a great selection of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Makeover needed.”
Reviews.Author: BethShan42
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sebel are friendly and always happy to help. Unfortunately the rooms are tired and drab: torn curtains, chipped furniture and stained carpet. Doesn't make for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but expensive”
Reviews.Author: adinda7
Reviews.Content: Situated a bit far from the center. The room is spacious and clean. Expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay at This accomodation should be *****”
Reviews.Author: papas1983
Reviews.Content: One of the best places l have stayed, staff excellant, room excellant, public tansport, just around the corner, and staff eager to assist with any need you may have. What you see on the web site is what you get. Very clean accomodation !!!!! My accomodation was a 50th birthday gift from my brother. Cant understand why this is not a 5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Physim
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night as over on a business trip. Staff are nice and the room was clean and spacious. But the TV did not work and the room was east facing therfore the curtains did not block out the sun in the morning making it very light quite early. Aworking TV and heavier curtains would have been an improvement. Buffet breakfast was very good. The location is Ok for holiday makers but I had to catch a taxi as it was 2km to Phillip St in the CBD, in traffic this cost $16.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didnt pay full rate”
Reviews.Author: Allymal
Reviews.Content: The big bonus for this hotel is its proximity to Central Railway station. The staff were ok but didnt go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The room was so filthy - the sofa looked like it was from a rubbish tip - there were stains all over it and there was so much dirt, fluff, food crumbs etc under the cushions it was disgusting. There was rubbish still in the bathroom from the last guests and it looked like it hadnt been cleaned in years - there was grime and hair etc every where. eeewww. Im glad I didnt pay full price thats for sure but still paid too much for what it was. Really cant get past the dirtiness factor - there is a difference between old and clean - you can live with that - and out right dirty - this was out right dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an overhaul pronto!”
Reviews.Author: Moby-Wan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 29th and 30th of Dec. prices during this period are inflated everywhere in Sydney and this is no exception. The negatives here outweigh any positives. Firstly the wall mounted tv. Analogue, stretched, with none of the additional options available on digital such as HD One, 7Mate etc the remote doesn't work properly either. There is no exhaust fan in the bathroom moisture saturates everything, the rooms are small, the heated spa & pool cold... One could go on but what is the point? We stayed here years ago and it was great but now it's near embarrassing. Pity!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and service but dont pay for deluxe”
Reviews.Author: no1dimples
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, with a friend and her young family. My superior single was the same as their double room. After the first night we were informed that due to maintenance of air conditioning units we would be upgraded to deluxe rooms for the remainder of our stay at no extra cost. The deluxe rooms had newer furnishings, smaller wardrobes and no bath, only a shower. Both rooms were lovely, dont get me wrong, but as a female tourist I wanted room to hang clothes and new purchases, and a bath to soak in after a long day exploring. The amenities were excellent, with a decent sized swimming pool (changing rooms attached) and a sauna - though this took quite a while to heat to a decent temperature. The staff could not have been more helpful and nothing was too much hassle. They were, I think, among the nicest staff I have met in my world-wide travels. So full praise to them. Breakfast can be purchased at reduced rate with the room. I would strongly recommend you do this. They serve buffet style a full range from continental, to full cooked english, to cereals, pastries, fresh fruit, etc. The little girls loved the freshly made pancakes and berry yoghurt. I found the fresh coffee -yes the proper stuff not cheap & instant- to be life saving in the mornings. The beds were comfortable and King-size is King-size, not a queen-size masquerading as King-size. Though the small raise in the middle of the mattress was interesting. I take my own pillow to any hotel I vist as I am fussy, but the ones available were not all squashed and matted inside and the bed itself did not have impressions of previous guests bodies in the mattress. As soon as my eyes closed I was asleep and slept soundly..... if it fitted in my suitcase I would have taken the bed home!! The only complaint I have is that on the last day there was no hot water for about an hour in the morning. It appears that emergency maintenance to the hot water supply took longer than anticipated and the reception staff (naturally) did not want to ring the rooms, waking guests, to inform them of this. Though a cold shower first thing in the morning can be considered invigorating and refreshing, its not really my idea of fun. Still I was awake when I got out :) So all in all I would recommend this hotel to families, singles, etc. It is child friendly, It is excellently situated: just down the road from a main station (no I couldn't hear the trains); next to the free city bus line; close the restaurants; about 20 minutes fast walk from the wharf; not near any night clubs so no noisy drunks to wake you at 3am. We initially took a taxi from the airport to the hotel, but returned via train which was cheaper and just as quick. So for those on a budget dont think the distance from the airport is a problem. Also with the free city bus link just down the road you can hop on and travel to the "tourist spots" free of charge. So you don't end up paying a fortune on in-city travel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, decent space, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: hallemu
Reviews.Content: booked by travel agent flight center. staff was extremely helpful, room had plenty of space. hotel needs to be updated. hotel is near an area that has seen its better days, includes a tattoo parlor and some business that aren't booming. could walk 15 minutes and be in china town and other attractions. better places to stay in sydney at equal price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, large and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: L0veATrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a city break for one night mid-week. Got a free upgrade from Superior to Deluxe room as part of a promotion. Nice, clean room with room for a sofa, desk and coffee table. Rooms were renovated so they were great. A little bare but totally fine. Location is good for some great restaurants in Surry Hills and for anyone who wants to be close to Central Station and the city. My only complaint was that the air con wasnt working in the room. We called front desk and they sent someone up who couldnt get it working so we were offered another room but it was a Superior one which wasnt as lovely as our Deluxe! So we opted to stay in the Deluxe and the staff bought in a fan for us which worked fine. They also threw in a complimentary buffet breakfast for 2 the next day so that was more than enough to make up for the inconvenience. Overall, a really pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not 4.5 star.”
Reviews.Author: the-foraging-goat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights Plus â€“ Convenient location for access to City, Darlinghurst, Paddington and Surry Hills; Small gym and pool; staff were helpful; got a superior room for only $149 per night; largeish room with bath; ok selection at breakfast buffet. Minus â€“ Road noise (stayed on the 9th floor facing Albion st, but still needed ear plugs); expected more from a 4.5 star hotel. Very noisy air conditioning in room; no Wi Fi; Needed to ask for the room to be made up (then they didn't change sheets); welcome bottle of sparkling wasn't there on arrival, had to phone reception to ask for it; Water in urn at breakfast buffet was luke warm every morning; no courtesy towels in the fitness centre. Overall, this is really a 3.8 star hotel at best.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: lillycorleone
Reviews.Content: It wasnt expensive, but still was not cheap enough for what it offered. There are better located, better value hotels in Sydney - Ive stayed in most of them. I was upgraded at the Sebel because they know I worked in Travel. The upgraded room had a sofa and chairs that were badly stained (like something had spilt on them and not cleaned up), they were badly worn with holes in the - the cushions were the same. This was not typical hotel wear and tear. The carpet desperately needed a steam clean. In general the rooms were grubby - Im not sure if the sheets were terribly clean either hence I didnt sleep well - not to mention the old mattress with holes in it. The bathroom was also very grubby. Definitely not a 4 star plus hotel in regard to cleanliness and service. Its also in Surry Hills, which while its close to Central station, its a fair way walk to the touristy parts and the business parts of the CBD. I wouldnt rate this above a 2-3 star hotel - in fact Ive stayed in better 2-3 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Bali_DMD
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay. Quiet and comfortable. Had a problem with the curtains - too much light coming through in the mornings. Fish pond could be improved and add a few more fish!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel01
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel and then decided to look at TA for some reviews on it. Needless to say, I arrived at the hotel expecting the worst and was prepared to be asked to a clean room! Well, I checked in and was given a room on the 3rd floor. All good..same level as the compact gym. The room was one with facilities for a disabled person so I rang down and requested to be moved. Within minutes someone was up with cards for a new room and it was clean and I was happy. I will admit that some one the room doors have chipped paint as you walk along the corridor but once inside the rooms, they are clean and well set out. I ordered room service and was pleasantly surprised there was no room service fee. Good menu with reasonable choices. The gym is compact with one each of the usual treadmill, rower, stepper, etc etc and some weights. It is airconditioned and has a water cooler for use. I had breakfast included and it was buffet style in the restaurant. It was just ok.. nothing to rave about. It was included in my room rate but other than that I wouldn't pay for it. The staff were friendly and if I had to, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Woderful hotel, very friendly staff and beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Travellerone_10
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, clean, modern. The bathroom was very nice and very clean. Large room. Very friendly staff, could not have asked them to be more helpful.Bed was super comfortable. I have read a lot of the reviews and the only downside I would agree with is that you can hear noise from the room next door, this is due to the room being part of an adjoining room, with the noise travelling through the door used to open the two rooms into one. The noise was bearable and not that loud and It would not stop me staying again. Had a meal from room service, although expensive, it was the best meal I have had in a long time and overall good value. Overall very happy and would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What no bath?”
Reviews.Author: papalotta
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and wasn't able to check in so asked if they'd call me when I could. No one call. Went back at 2 and was able to check in, asked the reception guy when the room had been read, he said about 12. Was a bit annoyed. Room tidy, clean, big bed, plasma, sofa etc. Really fed up that there was no bath, just a wet room type shower. Apparently baths are only in the Superior rooms. Service from reception a bit rubbish. Food okay. Location a bit vile. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service & Attitude”
Reviews.Author: PuffHorror
Reviews.Content: Once I arrived at the hotel, the immediate response from the staff was that utter chaos as it looked like it had beome a very busy night for them. The two staff on the Reception desk stood there and did not even acknowledge myself or my partner.
