There were papers all over the Front Desk and when someone did come and assist they asked if I was being looked after! I believe that the female who asked this question was a manager as she was confirming all details of my reservation, which the other two staff were not. When I went to question her about the issue of myself and partner standing in the line she tried to chuck a joke in stating that it was a busy night and her team was sufferring! I DON'T CARE ABOUT THAT! NOT MY PROBLEM! I have stayed here and at other Mirvac properties, but I will now refuse! I do not care if I am a VIP on there system or not, but one thing I agree and also other people I have spoken with is that the Management System in this hotel is SHOCKING!

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot better”
Reviews.Author: Bewhirly
Reviews.Content: Arrival and check in were pretty smooth and easy, however that's where things stopped being good. The hotel floor which we were staying on was always dirty and untidy. Upon walking to our room after check in (at about 5pm) we passed breakfast trays that were still out, towles and bedlinen strewn around down various smaller corridors and a general uncleaniness and untidiness. When we entered the room things didn't feel that much better. The bathroom really didn't look like it had been cleaned from the previous occupants and the bins still had their rubbish in them. As we were really only satying in the room for a couple of hours to sleep we didn't complain excpet upon checking out where we were given the usual "sorry about that, wont happen next time". I don't think there will be a next time for the price they are charging. However, this hotel is in a pretty good location close to Central Station and Surry Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and clean but a bit ho hum.”
Reviews.Author: Kbel3
Reviews.Content: Although this wouldn't be my first pick on a future trip to Sydney, it was a suitable base for a recent Girl's Weekend. Previously we'd stayed in the CBD but as we wanted to explore Surry Hills on this trip we opted for the Sebel. The location was quite good for our purposes but the hill up to Crown St is a killer so beware! It is close to Billy Kwong, Bill's and Assiette restaurants and some great bars, galleries and stores in Bourke, Cleveland and Crown Sts. The service was helpful and we were provided with our room in the early morning which was unexpected and very welcome. The staff are friendly and welcoming; my only issue with the lobby is the strange smell of heavily perfumed deodorizer that seemed to permeate the area. The room was clean and compact. We had booked a suite for the 3 of us and the beds were very comfortable. There were small things that I didn't love about this hotel but they're not bothersome enough to completely put me off. The bathroom was dark, the towel hook was missing and the room, though advertised as the second largest available felt quite cramped as it was awkwardly built into a corner of the building. Overall it gets an okay from me and the price is okay too... I just don't think I'd bother again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: DanNajjar
Reviews.Content: Went directly here after completing Philly > LAX > Sydney marathon flights and arrived around 10AM. We forgot to request early check-in but they accommodated our three person party upon arrived which was HUGE. As you'll see in other reviews, it was recently renovated so the room was nicely up-to-date with a wall-mounted flatscreen, two twin beds, and a pull out full-size sofa bed. Very clean and the bathroom was super nice. Really good showerhead with a cool glass pane rather than a shower curtain. Staff was accommodating, we left our bags at the desk for a few hours following checkout. There was a safe in the rooms. Surrounding area is pretty hip with some good breakfast spots, including Bruscetteria II and TT's Cafe right up the street. Happy hour at the hotel bar has decent beer specials from 4 - 6 PM. Only downside was the shrieking birds on neighboring buildings early in the morning. I've never heard a bird like that, sounded like a pterodactyl!

Reviews.Title: “Decent sized room for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: AlanLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 'deluxe' room with our two kids, aged 7 and 10. It wasn't particularly 'deluxe' - but it was big, ie large - and very comfortable - bed for parents, double sofa bed, for one child and still room for a single roll out for the other. Its very close to Central station, and not too far from Crown Street, for restaurants and shopping. We had a room at the back, so it was quiet. Service on front desk was very friendly and efficient. We thought it was fine for the price. Downsides: its a little sruffy round the edges, the pool was nowhere near the 27c indicated (ie it was freezing!), and the gym has seen better days. But the bathroom was fab, buffet breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: setthefire
Reviews.Content: I have very few complaints about The Sebel in Surry Hills. Having gotten a good deal on Wotif, I wasn't expecting much. My room was the newly renovated room with King Cloud bed (2 singles beds put together, but didn't matter, still was amazing!), sparkling clean and modern bathroom, comfy and big lounge and altogether spacious room. The mini bar fridge in my room was actually a freezer - it froze all my drinks, and it was way too overstocked. One morning I opened it up and a glass bottle of sparkling mineral water had smashed everywhere and was completely frozen, I didn't even slam the door, I don't know how it just smashed. I was frustrated because it cost $5, and I didn't even drink it! I brought this issue up to them when I checked out, and offered to pay if they didn't believe me, but they were courteous and said it was okay. The main complaint really was that the room got unbearably hot (we are in winter right now). The air conditioning has no way you can control it, except to turn it off or onto another fan speed, but it seemed no matter what I pressed nothing changed. I was on the 9th floor. Called reception a few times and they addressed this issue quickly - It seems there is an ongoing problem with quite a few of their air conditioners, but after a few minutes it cooled down and was at a bearable temperature. The walls are fairly thin, and I could hear doors slam all the time, but I did not hear any street noise whatsoever (I recommend the higher floors, as I requested mine and am glad I did). The location is fairly hidden away, ok if you want to walk a while to get to the heart of the city, but definitely not on the doorstep of the major shopping areas or cafes. A few nice cafes around the corner, 7/11 300 metres down which is helpful. Don't pay for in house movies, $16.95 to watch a new release! What a rip. Staff were all lovely, especially Ian who checked me in, the only staff I found mildly unfriendly were housekeeping, they seemed annoyed every time I called them to service my room as I didn't want to be disturbed when they came around early morning, but they did a good job and the room was clean. Will be back again for sure, all those issues were minor and not enough to make me think twice about staying again. Good value for money, I loved my room and stay and appreciated the friendliness of all staff encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, noisy, dirty, overpriced place - 3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: JulesTwinMum
Reviews.Content: We expected more of this hotel, but had a terrible experience and would never consider staying here again. The cold, unfriendly man who checked us in was the least of our worries. They are renovating... we were checked into a room with jackhammering so loud (from somewhere above/around us in the building) that we struggled to hear one another speak without shouting. I asked a man who appeared to be the housekeeping manager about the noise - he assured me it would last 1/2 hr or so and "absolutely not" all day. We went downstairs and spoke to the front desk manager, who said renovations begin every day at 8:30am and go until 5pm. We requested a different room, as my husband had work to do in the room during the day and the noise was atrocious. We were moved to a room in the 'old wing'. On the upside, the rooms are a good size. But, clearly the only thing they are renovating are the bathrooms, and not to any great degree as far as we could see. The room furniture was identical - and just as old and beaten up as in our first room. The bathroom in the room we moved to was horrible - rotting door frames/skirting boards, dirty, moldy tiles. However, after dealing with renovation noise, this was a tolerable alternative, until my husband took a shower and found a couple of hairs on one of their folded up bath towels that he used. Long, black, not at all like our hairtypes. We stayed 4 nights and everyday found either more black hairs or just dirt/hairs on the floor and in the bathtub - housekeeping is shocking here! Our new room overlooked the main road, and was about 15metres from the street corner - buses came roaring around and up the slight hill. Some rooms may be 'tucked away', but ours certainly wasn't. Luckily we had to be up by 7am every morning - a lie in past about 8am with the street noise would not have been possible. The lift buttons in one of the lifts didn't work properly... push as hard as we liked, no success. So we took to using the stairs to our 2nd floor room, rather than wait for another lift to arrive. Breakfast was possibly the only positive thing here... nothing incredible, but acceptable selection and quality, and a nice ambience with newspapers provided. This is a truly no-frills place, with few facilities and very basic rooms. Way overpriced - not worth anything like the room rates they are charging, with or without renovations/renovation noise. Best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near Central Station, clean”
Reviews.Author: illucid
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. It's been one of my staple hotels for when I visit Sydney. It's a great location, just a block away from Central Station, and its tucked behind Elizabeth Street, so you don't get all that traffic noise. It's always clean, and the staff are curteous. It's been refurbished and renamed - used to be known as the Citigate Sebel, now it's the Sebel Surry Hills. With the facelift came room renovations too, and an increase in price by about $50. And it's still a nice hotel, but I just don't think its worth the extra dollars. So I've started staying at some other hotels, but the convenience of this place keeps me coming back. Other reviews have commented on its dry-ness or staleness - but it is a hotel, presented in an almost clinical way. So, it is what it is. I stay here because of its geat location and decent service and its tucked away from the noise. There's a 7Eleven right on the corner which is convenient (although, there's usually some kind of drama out the front, it doesn't inconvenience hotel guests) and the place next door has delicious Pho. Definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely not stay in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: maquillage
Reviews.Content: The service wasn't as good as I expected. I knew that normally the check-in time should be 2pm, but other hotels (e.g. holiday inn) can also allow people to check-in even at 10am. I didn't expect that I need to wait until 2pm sharp to check-in. It's a bit ridiculous. Besides, normally every 4 star hotels must have dental kit inside the toliet, and i need to call the reception to get it and the slippers also, which wasted me more than 1 hr to wait. After 30 mins i called the reception, i asked the housekeeper to get me the dental kit, he said he would give me in 10 mins, but i've got no reply after 30 mins. Then, I had to call the reception again, and they told me there is no slippers inside the hotel, and they'll give me the dental kit soon. I can't believe that they're ALL BUSY. In additions, on the next day we stayed, normally the housekeeper would change all the towels. But they just tidy up those we've used, but not replacing the new one.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room but poorly cleaned.”
Reviews.Author: Ditaab
Reviews.Content: When I went to the hotel, we had requested a famous "cloud bed" which we did not receive. The tv did not work properley and I had to call reception & people had to come up on two occasions to fix it. Reception went to a voicemail first time I called. Found an empty 2 litre Coke bottle behind the sofa & the customer review form was still filled in from the last visitors stay. Great location, friendly staff but not happy with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JesskaTwo
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on wotif through the 'wot hotel' and this was the hotel booked. My partner checked in and upon check in paid an extra $20 for an upgrade (the room originally cost $110). Room was large but very bare. Walls are bare (only a TV on the wall) and white with the only color being green curtins. The mini bar was stocked so much that the rail holding this into the door didn't work so when you opened the mini bar things fell on the floor. Bed was large and comfy and I had the best sleep ever on it. There was alot of street noise that could be heard though. Location isn't the best, although would suit people who want to be close to the city without being in the heart of it. To be honest, was a nice enough hotel but it wouldn't be my first preference to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and charming staff”
Reviews.Author: Aucklandlass
Reviews.Content: Daughter and I needed a hotel, handy to Central Station and good cafes. I had stayed at this hotel before and found it to be satisfactory but this time was even better. We were checked in by Justin, a man of style and humour and given a beautifully upgraded twin bed room. Exactly what we required. Staff polite, Ian, Nicole most helpful and can take a bit of banter.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jem20_10
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel not knowing what to expect and was surprised - in a good way! It was close to the central train station, near to some great shops but a little out of the CBD- which was good as got to see more! Staff were pleasant and knew what they were doing! Room size was great. Prob only downside was it could have been better looked after - few marks and dints in walls so general ware and tear just needed looking into! Generally though the hotel was fine for my purpose; having somewhere decent to sleep whilst I got to explore Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for price”
Reviews.Author: beegee5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Wotif site - it was the 4.5 star secret hotel. Although at first I was disappointed it wasn't in the cbd as such, it was so close anyway. We got upgraded to the Deluxe King Room on level 9 & it also had a sofa bed/couch. room was big, huge window and smaller window that you could open - pretty scary to look down to the ground. Carpark underneath at $25 for 24hours & you could come and go as you please. We ate at a little cafe around the corner which was great called Flo - breakfast was brilliant there. From the hotel, head down the hill and turn right at the 7 eleven on the corner, follow until the next little laneway/road. Turn Right and it is just on the other side of the Buddha shop. Worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central, great value”
Reviews.Author: NZFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay, 16-17 April 2010. Booked a standard room but was upgraded to a Deluxe room. Room was very spacious, well appointed (recently updated by the looks of it), and was very clean. The room I had (902) was at the back of the building, was very quiet at night and had a great view towards the Sydney Tower (an unexpected bonus!). Checkin was great, very friendly. Only 5min walk from Central Station, 15-20 min easy walk to Darling Harbour. Overall I was very impressed and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value 4 star city accommodation”
Reviews.Author: happygilmoregolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sebel for one night mid week, as I was seeing the Ballet at the Opera House. The hotel is really close to Central station making travel around the city very easy. We had a great rate of $140 including breakfast for 2 and parking, which I thought was a fair price for the accommodation. The hotel itself has recently been renovated and has a great interior. The fish tank in the lobby is a nice touch. We stayed in a deluxe room which was very large and comfortable. The room was basic, but had all the features we required including a large flat screen TV. Our room faced Albion Street and was on the 6th Floor. Unfortunately the traffic noise outside was very loud all night, but I guess this is to be expected in such a location. The king best was very comfortable, and better than the Hilton Sydney I stayed in a few weeks ago. Buffet breakfast the next morning was also great, variety of hot and cold items. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as long as the price is around $150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Room Hotel Price”
Reviews.Author: travelguide100
Reviews.Content: II liked the location and the front lobby. From there it went downhill. I was told to talk the left to the left of the reception desk, which was down 5 steps, no ramp.. But there was a handicap lift I could have taken. My room was unimaginative at best, blank walls with the bed well offset from the television which was the only adornment on the walls. I felt like I was in a backwater motel. The air condition was ineffective, my room was humid, and the room was slightly grungy with cleaning that was appropriate to a backwater motel where you would expect dust bunnies under the bed, grime in the corners and an overall feeling of seediness. The television had 10 channels, again I felt like I was in no-where-land. The bed linens were clean and quite good quality. The mattress itself was like a sow backed horse. Once on the bed I rolled into its hammock like center and was quite uncomfortable. The bed sucked. The gym was mediocre as is most hotel gyms. The pool quite nice. The staff were good. The location was great in terms of closeness to the trains, and there were several good restaurants and pubs located close by. All in all a 2.5 out of 5 for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a bargain...problably not worth their regular rate...”
Reviews.Author: Dimefan3
Reviews.Content: Managed to book a night at The Sebel in Surry Hills for an EXTREMELY low price of 60 dollars off a website a person from work reccomended. I was a little skeptical, but upon arriving at the room I was very happy with the find. A very spacious room, and although their 'King' size bed was two singles pushed together I slept quite well. I was expecting the staff to not give me much attention being I was staying at more than below cost but they were very friendly and helpful in my request for directions to Paddys Market, and also validating my parking ticket on the way out. Would I stay there again? Being on a budget probably not at full price, but if a price like what I paid for came up again, then most definitely. Probably the only negative thing I would have to say about my stay is that stupid $50 credit card validation thing that major hotels have a habit of doing - I had expected it so I made the point of putting fifty dollars on a card I don't use often and using that card instead. Seriously I don't know why some hotels do this but other hotels don't need to - its a practice that I think should be illegal, or at least made part of the rate. Granted they tell you that you get it back when you check out but it actually takes a week, as the bank has to clear it. From a hotels point $50 may not be much but for those on a budget it could mean $50 that (in the worst case) you may need to get home. *Gets off soap box* Sorry, just had to vent. But I'm sure theres people that agree with me. By the way, I didn't mention Breakfast as I've made it a rule not to have breakfast a the hotel, ever since having a cold buffet breakfast at another certain hotel chain. In this case a simple bowl of cereal sets you back $9. I walked around the corner, found a cafe, had pancakes and a coffee for $14.50. So much better.

Reviews.Title: “fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: patkoaus
Reviews.Content: The sebel was offering an escape special of $199 for a renovated deluxe room, free overnight parking and 2 buffet breakfasts. We were meeting friends for dinner in the city so booked 2 rooms. We booked direct from the hotel, same price as wotif. Booking was a breeze, check-in was a breeze. Our room was very nice and roomy, our friends wasn't as nice but still roomy, clean and renovated. The buffet breakfast was very good with a wide range available. the only thing that wasn't nice was the coffee. It was very convenient for what we wanted and there was nothing for us to criticize Just make sure you ask for a renovated room by other reviews on here. Hubby left a shirt and it was posted to us (COD though, bit expensive at $12.50). Overall we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: psjcdt
Reviews.Content: On arrival appeared to be lovely in the reception area although things changed when we got into rooms! They had a nasty odour, The vent was hanging from the ceiling, The tiles in the bathroom were craked, The windows and curtains were filthy and the third bed was a dirty camp bed!!! I queried and was advised the Superior rooms were Budget equivalent although the manager (Who I later found was not a manager at all!) agreed to refund my account fro the first night as she was unable to move us until the following day and we would be upgraded free of charge. The following day our bags were moved into the same equivalent room so another trip to reception before we were finally given decent rooms and a free breakfast for our troubles. When we checked out we questioned the refund which we were then informed that the lady was not the manager. I e-mailed Agoda who we booked through who contacted the Hotel. The Sebel replied saying that there was no refund offered I am still persuing it but the after care is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: 1_TravelAddict_1
Reviews.Content: I booked it via internet because they had a summer special ($149 for deluxe room with buffet breakfast). I was quite impressed! the staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was recently renovated and the bed was very comfortable. Buffet breakfast had lots of choices and the hotel was faily close to a lot of facilities and train station. The only downside was a swimming pool and sauna. Ever though it was meant to be heated the water was fairly cool. You had to get out of spa to turm it on and the bubbles would go off very quickly. The sauna wasn't working at all. Plus they had no seperate swimming pool for children so we had lots of annoying kids splashing around while we were swimming. I would recommed this hotel to a friend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT Good value for Money!! dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: EM_8567
Reviews.Content: I do not usually complain however was quite dissapointed with the level of accommodation, I had a fairly high expectation hearing good reviews of this hotel - the service and staff were great and it was not their fault - however - the air con in our room didnt work - it was like a sauna, when I asked reception- I was offered a pedestal fan for the room and told that this was common in the hotel when it was really hot outside..... There were marks on the walls and light switch in the room was coming out of the wall. I booked through an entertainment card and the total bill still came to approx $500 for 2 nights and that was with free parking - no mini bar items were used - in comparison to other hotels in the area e.g. the Amora Jamison (5 star ) at the Rocks- I have stayed here for a cheaper rate in the last 6 months (approx $180 p/night) ... I am more than happy to pay money for quality accomodation The Sebel Surry Hills was overall just dissapointing for the amount we had to pay!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Rajah1
Reviews.Content: Stayed her on February 5th, attending the Military Tatoo, Check in was efficient and friendly, good advice on transport to and from Moore park on the special buses running from Central Station, about i 1/2 blocks easy walk. King Bed fantastic, bathroom spotless and generous shower head. Valet parking extra, but worth it and staff her again friendly and helpful. Only bug was our in room dining experience. At 11.30 pm we ordered 2 meals and this was very disappointing. Looks like reheated in the microwave and very poorly presented. However other than this is was convenient, comfortable, clean and our room facing Albion Street was surprisingly quiet. We would stay here again, but not order in room dining.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer services generally... minor faults in most rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dat68s
Reviews.Content: In the past 12-18 months I have stayed at this hotel over 25 times through travelling for business. Firstly it's the preferred choice so it's a "no brainer" to stay here but with the renovations to most of the hotel complete it's very close to be excellent in every way. The good: The staff are generally sensational, very efficient, very helpful and great to talk to. The location is also superb not only for business but for access to the CBD without being directly in it. The beds are very comfy, the Townhouse Bar is great (and also have good staff). I haven't used the restaurant but if the food in the bar is anything to go by I am sure it will be good. The not so good: Generally not much, however I have stayed in very many different rooms and generally there is a very small thing that is perhaps not quite right. For example on my last visit the room had a very large window area and even with the blinds closed the air-conditioning couldn't quite keep the room at a comfortable temperature, not stifling but not ideal. In other rooms the bathrooms have been renovated but someone forgot to do the shower head and being tall it's a struggle to fit under. Overall though the service, location and other features make up for the slight apprehension of not knowing if there will be something not quite up to scratch in the room. Seriously it would take very little to move this from a 4-ish star rating to a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GUSCuritiba
Reviews.Content: Great Customer Service, very helpful staff. I still can remember their names as we became close friends during my 4 days stay. Ian, Buster and Monique. Booked the deluxe service. Room was clean, with a big balcony, but it was more a standard room than a deluxe. Hotel is very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for Sydney, but you get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: fried_burger
Reviews.Content: Good points: - great location (near Central Station, Chinatown) - 1 friendly staff - cheap (found it on wotif, AUD 109 per night) - nicely renovated (bathroom was nice) Bad points: - this hotel cannot call itself 4 stars!!! - lobby is not very clean - lift is disgusting - some hotel staff were rude, some were ok, some didn't really know much - room conditions were ok, good size, but just don't look at the windows, dirty as! Dust, spider webs, also the carpet didn't seem very clean (did't want to walk on it without shoes) - don't expect to get a room before check in time (I even had to wait another hour after check in time for my room to be ready, actually at check in time, my allocated room wasn't even cleaned) - I wouldn't recommend the hotel if you arrive in Sydney in the morning after a long flight

Reviews.Title: “Clean, slick and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: Quite impressed with this hotel, given the low cost. This Sebel hotel has large beds with plenty of pillows, a modern bathroom, in-room internet access and mini-bar and a large TV. The staff are also exceedingly friendly and there is a large pool and a gym. On the downside, the walls in this hotel are a little thin, leaving you open to noise from the outside and from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: sjw25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after Christmas on a wotif deal rooms $AUD159/night. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The bed is a little on the soft side. The rooms were very quiet. It is a great location- it is close to the fabulous eating in Surrey Hills, short walk to China Town and close to public transport (Central Station and buses on Elizabeth St). If there are 2 or more of you, dont get the airport train $15pp. A cab from Mascot airport was $30. The hotel is a little soulless, but given that the hostel around the corner was charging $AUD69pp in a 6 bed dorm, I will take soulless anyday!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, friendly helpful staff, great location for us”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix123a
Reviews.Content: Really happy right from the staff, front desk staff so helpful, bags delivered to room within a few minutes, good advice on where to go and eat. Room lovely, bed super comfortable, bathroom nice and clean. Fantastic breakfast, alot of choice. Good gym with standard weights and good variety of exercise machines - pool great as well. We got a great deal on Wotif - it ended up being one of the mystery hotels and deal inc breakfast. A few minutes walk from the Central Station which is so easy to use to get up and down from Circular Quay and only 10-15 min from the airport by train - would 100 times rather stay at the Sebel than some nasty airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Amy1601
Reviews.Content: The room was so dirty, I would have run away! I don't think they had vacuum our room for the last weeks... hair on the carpet, crumbs, bigger crumbs, even a hair clip... Then the door for the bathroom was cringing, not only ours, we could here the one of the next room too! Shower water pressure was so low... you really wonder how can this happen in what looks to be like a nice hotel in Sydney. Staff was not cooperative and make no effort to be understood as my partner does not speak English fluently. I would not recommend this place for a second...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottR12
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice. Concierge and front desk were very helpful. Pool was not available - which was a bit of a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: cnellLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed at this hotel and really enjoyed it. It has a convenient location (right near central train station and hop on/hop off bus stop), modern decor, and really comfortable mattresses. Also, the service was top notch. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value but book early for good rates”
Reviews.Author: a78jumper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a total of five nights-paid Au$98 per night having booked three month in advance. Rooms on some of the nights I stayed were going for $338 the week before I travelled. Room was clean and refurbished, no problem checking in at about noon as my flight from Canada arrived in the morning. Easy walking distance from Central Statin where train from airport takes you for $16. Close to downtown Sydney. Cheap internet cafes, 711 and laundromat just around corner. Recommend "Naughty Chef" Vietnamese restaurant for a quick bowl of noodles as an evening meal. Prince Albert pub not far, and off the beaten tourist track to meet locals. I did not use the in hotel bar or restaurant. Buffet breakfast was offered at a check in rate of $19, $10 off which may appeal to some. One beef, the room carpet was clean but the hallways/elevators really needed to be vacumed with a vacumn with a beater bar/brush instead of just a wand type. Pool and hot tub OK, as was sun deck. I was happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money ever!”
Reviews.Author: foxylady11
Reviews.Content: It cost us only AUD 169 for 2 people which included breakfast at 6am which is good for early flights. We are a very fussy 50+ couple and were rapt with this place. A short walk to the Central Railway Stn, plus yummy cheap eatery called Elephant Jump up the hill. The bed was the best ever, so their claim is true. Traffic was noticeable early on, but when we closed the heavy curtains we did not hear anything. Good shower/bathroom and although we chose the basic room it was superb value, heaps of space, and had everything we needed, especially considering hotel prices in Sydney. Where else can you pay such a low price for this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get the refurbished wing.”
Reviews.Author: 28diane
Reviews.Content: Sebel Surry Hills is reasonably priced and conveniently located, close to some of the major sight-seeing places as well as the public transportation system. Its strategic location is further enhanced by the friendliness of its hotel staff and the cleanliness and comfort of its rooms. Just a word of caution, make sure you opt for the refurbished wing - that gives it a four star hotel feel.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't waste my time with this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: CarolannPhotos
Reviews.Content: where to I start? The rooms were old and smelled. Definitely not as nice as the photos lead you to believe. We had 2 twin beds vs. a king - we tried pushing them together, but my bed was about 2 inches taller than my husbands so that didn't work. And no comforter - just sheets.... The bathroom was falling apart - a giant crack throughout the tiles, and was gross. All we heard all night was the train station and traffic. And $9.00 for cold cereal in the morning? Give me a break! It was the most expensive hotel we stayed at in Sydney, and it was the worst! i'd suggest searching for other deals!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: holidayloverAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in a deluxe room. The room was quite nice ,large with a sofa. The bathroom was small in comparison with the shower over the bath. Didnt eat at the hotel. Location good if you dont mind being a bit out of the city. Close to train station and the free shuttle bus goes close by. staff were friendly . nothing out of the ordinary but notning to complain about either.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute bargain - Not perfect but can't complain at the price”
Reviews.Author: Zato1chi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at around 95 AUD a night, which is an absolute bargain given what you get. Sure it's not perfect; the paint in the room was tatty in places and the staff give the feel of students doing holiday work. However, for that price we got a large relatively quiet stylish room, huge double bed, big tv and swimming pool all in a very central location. Go to Brisbane and you'll struggle to find a double room in a dirty hostel for less than 80 AUD. If you're looking to do Sydney on a smallish budget this is the place for you. If you're looking for the height of elegance, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great price... amazing place!!!”
Reviews.Author: tabathalonga
Reviews.Content: I was extremelly lucky, they were renovating a few rooms and had this special deal at lastminute.com, rates from AU$47,00... unbelievable... I spent 11 great days there, rates between 47 - 81 and 111 dollars. You can walk to train station, free shuttle bus 2 min away to circular quay and great caffes and restaurants!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, without being great”
Reviews.Author: JKAuckland
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. 4 stars is about right (not 4.5 that Wotif claims). Staff were young and helpful and willing to assist in room changes. Rooms were clean, without being spotless but room noise was a little high and the air-con was a little noisy but maintenance were helpful. Location is good for access to Oxford St and Surry Hills, a bit out of the way for the city unless you get a train (Central very close). Internet $8/hour. Free papers though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davdaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sebel Surry Hills for 4 nights at the end of April and had an overall positive experience. I took advantage of a remodeling special and was able to stay here for just $6/night more than a private room at the nearby hostel! Front desk: All staff were helpful, from check-in to check-out. Common features: Lobby had been remodeled with a somewhat austere modern design. Indoor pool and hot tub were pleasant but barely used by hotel patrons. Hot tub water was filled to an oddly low level, leaving too much of my 6'1" body exposed above the water. Breakfast wasn't included in my room special, so I can't comment on it. Room: Remodeled with the same austere modern elements found in the lobby. Comfy bed, sofa, coffee table, desk, mini-fridge, and flat-screen TV. TV got about a dozen fuzzy channels--this is cable? Coffee table and desk had not been dusted. Mini-fridge was overstocked, and a bottle fell out simply by opening it. (More on this later.) There were views of the street from my room on the third floor, but I wasn't staying here to see Sydney's skyline, so that didn't bug me. (Some rooms look onto the roof of an adjacent building, which would bug me.) Drapes: Although the room had been remodeled and had newer furnishings, the drapes were stained and dirty. The fact that they didn't match anything else in the room suggests they had not been replaced as part of the remodel. This was further confirmed when the drape rod fell down while I was closing one of them, forcing me to contact the front desk to get it put back up. Bathroom: Also remodeled, but with an awkward shower design. It was half open and flush with the remainder of the bathroom floor. Absolutely terrible design. Also, the shower handle came off when I tried to turn it on the second night. I was able to put it back on myself, but it shouldn't have come off to begin with. Also, there were insufficient hooks to hang up towels, clothes, etc. Location: I had a morning train to catch on my way out of town, so I really liked being walking distance from Central Station. If you don't have a morning train to catch, though, other parts of the CBD are more central to visitor amenities and tourist attractions. Price: Got a steal of a deal, but most people won't be so lucky. The credit card fee was a tacky addition; one would expect it to be quoted in the hotel price. Also, the front desk tried to charge me for that bottle of water that fell out of the overstocked min-fridge. I protested and the charge was removed without incident, attesting to staff professionalism. Overall: Once construction is done and some attention is spent on the details (drapes, dust, shower handles, mini-fridges), the Sebel Surry Hills may be a nice place to stay. In the meantime, book here if you find a good deal but don't have the same expectations you would of a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get aq refurbished room”
Reviews.Author: mrken22
Reviews.Content: Booked with wotif.com not sure if this is why we ended up with a crumby room in the part of the hotel not yet refurbished. Room 704 and the original room furniture seemed to have bee replaced with older more down market temporary furniture. The bathroom have many tiles missing from the wall and dripping taps. Lots of drilling noise from about 8.30 - 3.30 ( not the place for an afternoon nap!) However the price was good for a hotel in this location and an easy walk from Central Station and its connection to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye71
Reviews.Content: I want to take this time to recognize the staff at Sebel Hotel â€“ Surrey Hills for helping to make our stay an unforgettable experience in Sydney. From the time we checked into the hotel until our check out the staff had provided exceptional service. When our room wasnâ€™t ready for an early check in the concierge (Ken) not only had offered to check our baggage but suggested that we not waste any time and explore Sydney. He had given us various brochures and maps including a bus pass to Circular Quay to start our vacation. Enough canâ€™t be written for the exceptional service and friendliness shown to us by Ken. Not only did he take the stress out of planning excursions but he came to the rescue when we realized we had a flight conflict on the day we were flying out. Luckily for us, he took the time to research and remedy the conflict all the while he sent us out to enjoy our last day. We were pleasantly surprised when we checked into our room at the amenities and overall appearance. It was definitely worth upgrading to the â€œpremiumâ€� package. The rooms were quiet and spacious and the beds were quite comfortable. Our hotel package included buffet breakfast which was always tasty and plentiful. Along with Ken Ryce and George, whom both work in the main restaurant, were two other individuals who made us feel like we were locals with their friendly greetings every morning and insightful talks on what to do and enjoy that day. The location of the hotel had made getting around very easy since it was only a couple blocks away from Central Train Station. Overall I would stay there again and again and definitely recommend this hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TROYDelhi
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon to Goldcoast and Sydney for a total of 7days & 6 nights. First 3 nights stay at Goldcoast was excellent, the 3 nights that we spent at Sydney's Sebel Surry Hills (or citigate Sebel) were also good, however nothing in comparision to the GC stay. The sebel was under renovation at that time, on our reaching there we informed the receptionist that we're honeymooners and would want a room with a view, but still she put us to a one facing backside of another building, after we'd shown our dissatisfaction she gave us another that was facing the street. The room was pretty large and had a nice sofa and large bed and all amenties that one would want, especially a clean & large bathroom with a standard bath tub. The room service was good. but one thing that was bad was the passge to the rooms & the lobby - which were like old & unkept giving a look of an unattended apartment. The free breakfast was no match to what we enjoyed at the GC hotel, and at times it did get finish off pretty fast with guests waiting for sometime for more to come. The good thing about this hotel was that it was not far off from the main markets, we could walk our way to the China Town, it was a close to the Sydney harbour. My rating for food is average, for hotel lobby looks & maintenance (apart from rooms) is low, while that for interiors is good. Overall an average rating, not meant for Honeymooners, but could be useful for frequent travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Albiedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with our 4 year old, as the hotel had a package on with Easter Show Tickets, parking and breakfast included. We paid an extra $20 to upgrade to the Deluxe Room as I found out refurbishment is not complete and this applies to the superior rooms. .Apparently they only have new beds and not new bathrooms and I had read the dismal reviews about the bathrooms. The room was fine, new bathroom, curtains are still old and didn't quite reach the end of the tracking, a very small gap. Bathroom was new which was reassuring. Parents of babies/ young children check if your room has a bath when booking, as ours only had a shower. However this wasn't a problem for only one night. Yes you do hear traffic, sirens etc but you have to expect this being next to Elizabeth St. House keeping service was a little slow but I think the hotel was quite busy this particular weekend. Breakfast was ok, they had run out of weetbix. A good location for those relying on public transport. Pool was fine, is 15 metres and indoor. A short walk to Central Station. Would possibly stay again but only if the special was on, would not pay top dollar as I would want to be in a better part of town if I was paying big money.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Central station and Crown Street”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandDave0
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for work last week and its an OK hotel. Chose this as its right around the corner from where I was working and within walking distance to Central Station and the train to the domestic airport. Stayed on the third floor opposite the Gym. It was a quiet room of a generous size that had recently been refurbished. Good bed (king) and choice of pillows. The bathroom was similarly generous in size. Although recently refurbished, it was a cold featureless room with old dirty curtains and a well-worn sofa. The TV was on the wall opposite the bed, a bit hard to see from anywhere else in the room (i.e. the sofa). In all, good value with breakfast included - a mediocre buffet of hot/cold food. The coffee out of the machine was abmismal.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but restaurant staff need training!”
Reviews.Author: Delva
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night only with husband for dinner with our son who lives in Surry Hills. Upon check in at 1.50pm we were told our room was not ready and asked to sit in the reception area and wait. 10 minutes pased, nothing, 20 minutes passed and finally we were given our key and room number. Room was supposed to be upgraded from superior to deluxe as part of the package I had purchased but when I enquired, Steph from check in, advised as they were full that night no upgrade was available! Disappointing!! Room was just ok, very bland but ok for the price. The bed looked comfy but I had a really bad nights sleep which had a lot to do with the street noise I believe. Four of us had dinner in the house restaurant, Albies. There was a mix up with our main courses and my husband and I had already finished ours before our son and his partner had even received theres!! Not very conducive to a relaxing dining experience. I must say though that the waiter was apologetic and provided us with complimentary coffee and a discount off the bill which was appreciated. Breakfast was very standard and poorly laid out, people were bumping into each other trying to get to various things and the coffee out of the machine was really horrible. I also had to ask for my complimentary 2 for 1 drink voucher down at reception a few hours after we checked in as this was also in the package. We only stayed here due to the close proximity to our sons residence and we probably wouldn't stay again, main reason being the noise factor late at night. Perhaps the hotel should consider investing in double glazing the windows or some other sound proofing measure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: TortolaTanya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a 5-star South Pacific cruise, and so were anticipating weaning ourselves off all the self-indulgence of the cruise lifestyle. The Sebel Surry Hills was the perfect stopping point, as the 5-star level of service continued! Knowing nothing about Sydney, we chose this hotel mainly for the good price. It far exceeded our expectations. It is in an excellent location, close to free bus, pay bus, and train, and close enough to downtown for an energetic walker. The spacious room is nicely laid out, with a good sitting area, and a large clean bathroom. There is an excellent pool and hot tub, and an ok gym. Also a nice rooftop terrace, although they need more lounge chairs. You can include breakfast as part of your rate, and it is a huge, well done, hot breakfast buffet with excellent coffee. The concierge, Ken, is dynamite with restaurant, attractions, and travel tips - his personability sets a high standard for all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, ok location!”
Reviews.Author: sivling
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days in february. 2 days alone, and 2 days with a friend. The room was ok, plenty of space and good beds. The room could do with some upgrading, but it was ok, Some wear and tear. I stayed at the 8th floor, and it was quiet, no noise or other disturbing elements. The elevators are the big minus. You can end up waiting for a long, long time. Several times I took the fireescape when I went to the fitness room og swimmingpool, because I got tired of waiting. The fitnesscenter is just a few equipment, but if you are desperat to get some exercise, it will do, but don't expect too much. The swimmingpool was quite goo, you can exercise here, and you can also relax here. Few people, makes it much better. The staff were friendly, and polite. The only negative thing was that when we asked about places to go out(pubs, disco) the guy behind the desk was clueless and sent us to Darling Harbour. And there was nothing there at 01.00 at night. However, we found another place that we just loved and that is very popular(so the guy should have know about it): 3 Wise Monkeys at the corner of George Street and Liverpool Street. If you don't have any idea where to go, you should try it. Maybe you will enjoy it as well. New band playing every night. 10- 15 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is located close to the Central Railway station, so if you arrive by plaine it's so unbelievable easy to take the train downtown Sydney. It takes 10 minutes. Much better than taxi or bus. I felt secure at night walking back and forward to the hotel. It's like any other city, take your precautions, but don't stay inside because you think it's scary to go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Has Everything! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: TSSHS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work, beds are magnificent and the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I stayed in a 4th floor renovated room, great space, near the pool - which is huge as far as hotel pools go - and quiet. Ate in Townhouse - the bar on ground floor - food was great and service very good and friendly. Heaps of beers on tap and even some from the bloke who owns the hotel! All in all a great stay, I will be staying again; new business centre was very handy during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, neat and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: luxury_backpackers
Reviews.Content: We stayed there not expecting a lot and were pleasantly surprised. We picked it primarily on location (Which is fantastic for city, inner west and eastern suburbs). The hotel has been recently renovated so if you've stayed there before, it may be a bit improved! It's a fairly "vanilla" Sebel type hotel but that's all we wanted. Reasonabley priced and clean. Perfect for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location but with problems”
Reviews.Author: Miles4BG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a single night on an internet special - lower rate than usual with breakfast & two drinks thrown in. The location is fantastic - near the city and walking distance (20 mins) to the Hordern Pavilion, SCG, etc. Was upgraded to a "deluxe" room but was utterly unable to tell the difference between that and "superior" apart from the size of the TV. Reception forgot to give me my drink vouchers and seemed surprised when I asked for them. Room was reasonably clean but not amazing (there was some kind of gunk still on the bathroom floor from the last person who stayed...!) Requested a room on a higher floor but was given a room with a view of 3 office blocks and nothing else, quite awful and left the curtain closed the whole time. Apart from that, room was pretty good - spacious and some Foxtel available on the TV. Room service incredibly slow - said 20 minutes but took closer to an hour. Would have been a very okay stay but the following morning was woken early by some sort of hammering - never figured out what it was from (renovation work was complete). Got back to sleep but was woken by a cleaner trying to open my door despite me double locking it and putting a "privacy" sign out front. Same thing happened 45 minutes later with the same girl, despite me explaining I had a late checkout. Bizarrely, had yet another person knock on my door half an hour after that, asking me when I was leaving. Incredibly annoying. Complained to reception, they said they'd talk to the cleaners but did nothing further. They're under no obligation to, but it would have been nice if they'd made a gesture of good will. As it is, I would only stay here again for price & location, not for quality of hotel - if I could find something else I'd go for that.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service, dirty, yuk food - jolly noisey and quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bogart04
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this hotel passes itself off as being four star - fior a little more money go to the Sydney Hilton - it really is a four star hotel. I have been staying here for seven nights on a business trip. The rooms are po0rly serviced - one dayt i got no towels, another day i got no toiletries and only twice have i actually received a full complement of toiletries. One day my toilet was not cleaned ... the list goes on. The other day I called for a room service menu and was told i ought to have one. After highlighting that my call was due to the fact I did not have one I was toild I would be bought one. After an hour i called back and eventually a menu arrived. I must be an idiot because this ought to have warned me as to what might come. The food arrived but without a bottle openewd to open my capped softdrink, no coffee cup for the coffee and for some reason the salad was ridiculously salty (as it was only lettuce and tromateos this was even more curious). The next day my friend and I were both ill. I would not eat anywhere in this hotel - the food is lousy and quite expensive when you consider how yuk it is. Oh y6es and the lift has been broken for days - it kind of works but wont stop on level four - which is an issue as my friend is staying on level four. Overall i think this would warrant two stars and ought to be much cheaper than it is. The location is good (one star) but noisy. The aircon is also noisy. The other star is pure generosity - I suppose it does have a pool, but this also seems a bit unmaitained and unclean, like the spa and sauna. There is much better value and service aviaalble in Sydney for the same money - don't stay here! I've ticked "not sure" fopr room service because while they did deliver food that made us ill it took over an hour to bring me a munu and then the food arrived without the associated condiments and eating/drinking utensils. So would you call this room "service"?

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay... service is a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: T-A-UK
Reviews.Content: The Citygate Sebel is now called the Sebel Surry Hills. I stayed there for two nights in late Febuary. Initial impressions of the hotel were that the refurbished rooms were nice, clean and spacious. I had a room facing the side street and apart from noise from idiots drinking out on the street corner it was quiet. The foxtel in the room only extended to sport, good if you like sport not so good if you don't which unfortunately I don't. I got a good deal as they had just refurbished (two complementary drinks and free breakfast) but I had to drag the coupons and the information of where breakfast is out of the person working on reception. He seemed far more interested in anything else rather than checking me in properly. Also watch what you are charged for room service, they tried to charge me $6.5 for sparkling water when the menu stated it should be $3.5 and also the multiple menus are confusing. There are 3 menus, the bar menu refers to the prices you would pay in the bar as opposed to the All day dining (which is the room service menu) is the prices you pay in your room ($5 more expensive) Would I stay there again, possibly its quiet a convienant location... I would just want to get another good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: zegnaWiltshire
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Ideally situated to the shops etc. Staff were amazingly helpful, especially Ken the concierge who was able to recommend fantastic things to do and see during our short stay in Sydney. A boat trip over to Watsons Bay and a meal at Doyles is a must. This place is great value for money and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Metwo3
Reviews.Content: We prepaid via Expedia to get a lower rate over Australia Day weekend, but when we checked in the fellow in front of us had a much lower rate, so check around. Friendly desk staff. The manager handled our problem. There was some construction blocking pathway. One of only two elevators broke down for at least a full day/night. Phone instructions on phone do not work--you must dial the numbers on the paper envelope given with your key at reception. We first had a room facing the street on the 4th floor. Cars and trucks racing up the hill well past midnight. We later changed to a rear facing room--totally quiet. I had asked for a quiet location, but forgot to say anything when we checked in tired at 10pm. King bed was comfortable. Flat screen tv. Walk in shower. Seemed to be a renovated room. The first room just wouldn't cool down. It was terribly hot in Sydney, but the lobby was cool and our room stayed lukewarm no matter how low we set the thermostat. The hallway on our floor was like an oven. We complained on our way out for a long day and the staff said someone would get right on it. We returned late to find they had left a key in so the a/c would be running, but it wasn't a matter of time it was running but how cool/hot the air was. So we asked to move rooms and the manager moved us at 8pm to a room on the 8th floor. This took awhile as I couldn't figure out what was wrong with the phone, so walked down to lobby, got new room key, waited to ride up one working elevator, checked that room OK and cool, walked down to old room, packed up and waited for elevator--you get the picture. New room held comfortable twin beds but not quite as nice as first room. Refrigerator was off. No minibar. No robes. Furnishings a little worn. Shower over tub. But it was quiet and a little cooler. I don't know if it was the a/c or the dropping outside temps. The windows in the rooms open and this was an option in the second room, but the first was too noisy. Lots of people going to/from pool, but we didn't use. Paid $4 per 30 minutes to use their computer/printer in business center. Short walk downhill back to Central. Not many restaurants or shops in area--7-11 has been mentioned; also a Vietnamese restaurant, but that's about all.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: AucklandGopo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to get to from the airport. The train takes you from the airport to central station and then its a five minute walk. There are close and frequent buses and trains to Circular Quay or else its 30 or 40 minutes walk. The hotel room was spacious and clean. When I arrived the wardrobe door was not attached. Within 5 minutes of me phoning reception someone was there and fixed it immediately. There are tea and coffee making facilites and a fridge. Milk was replenished daily. The air con worked and the windows opened. The room had 2 queen beds which were very comfortable and the bedding seemed clean. I was attending a conference in the hotel. The conference was well organised and the food was good. The hotel restaurant was closed due to renovations but the bar had a good happy hour and reasonably priced and tasty food. Room service food was also pretty good but a bit more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: captainpaula
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights in a standard double room. It is located 5 minutes from central station & just off Elizabeth street. It is only a few minutes walk downtown. The hotel is not decorated quite as modern as many of the hotels in Sydney, but it is clean and welcoming. The bedrooms are spacious & the bed comfortable. The bathroom is clean and has what you need. The swimming pool is lovely. It was empty the time we spent there so had it to oursleves. It's clean and not too cold! There's a spa pool & a sauna too. The hotel also offers massage for a price too I think. There's a nice sundeck - but it was raining when I was there so didn't get to use it. There's also a small gym. The hotel is safe & secure. The staff are friendly. the place is clean & the rooms are comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: rolyat_au
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Citygate Sebel roughly once a month for business, and it's generally a good stay. The rooms have recently been updated - some with beech wood furniture, other's with a more modern and sleek black finish. The bathrooms are very pleasant now, modern, clean and well appointed. The internet, as other reviewers have mentioned, is expensive ($25 per day), but on the flip side the parking ($10 per day) is relatively cheap for a location so close to the city. In way of location, the Sebel is perfect. Aprox. 20 - 25mins from the airport and roughly five minutes drive to Darling Harbour / Harbour Bridge & the Opera House etc. The staff are friendly and courteous, though a little unprofessional and not particularly organised. It's often the case that the left hand doesn't seem to know what the right hand is doing, so if you have any issues expect it to take a few phone calls to different departments to get them sorted out. Room Service food is fine - not spectacular, but what can you expect from room service? Restaurant breakfast is standard bacon & eggs etc.. Again, nothing special. Can't comment on dinners as I haven't eaten there for anything other than Breakfast. There's a courtyard located at the end of the hallway on level five that's open from 6am to 10pm, but take note - if you're in a room on level 5 they do NOT have mini-bars - you need to get a Smart Card from reception to use a vending machine located in the corridor. Full mini bar in rooms on other floors. As other reviewers have pointed out, there are minor renovations going on in the foyer and reception areas, but they don't get in the way of anything. At the bottom of the street, no more than fifty feet away is a Seven Eleven, and there's a bottle shop about one hundred meters up Elizabeth St. toward the train station. Plenty of restaurants near the area, and a very quick (maybe five minutes) walk into the heart of the city. Overall, a good hotel for the cost, all the facilities you could want, comfortable rooms and friendly staff. As I mentioned I stay here generally once a month and, whilst I've had a few minor issues (more so in my recent visits), in most cases the hotel has been more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Citigate”
Reviews.Author: NelsonNZ
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Citigate from the 4th -7th June. We booked this hotel through Wotif website, it was listed as the secret hotel, located in the CBD, 4 star rating. You don't know whqt hotel it is until after you booked it. We paid $ 140.00 a night and were very happy with it. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We were given a large room on the 9th floor with 2 queen size beds, it was very clean and tidy. We did have some problems with internet which still have to be resolved. Paid $ 15.00 for two hour interent access but also seemed to have been charged for downloads. Not sure if this is correct or not. Also found the temperature of the shower to be a bit disconcerting. It changed from cold to hot frequently without touching the control and could be dangerous if a child was showering. Overall we were very happy with the hotel. It is very central, close to the train station (about a 6 minute walk), we took the train to the International airport and that was very easy to do. We also attended a show at the Sydney Entertainment centre and one at the Capitol theatre and both were about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Would stay there again if got the Wotif rate.

Reviews.Title: “Value and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: romaxho
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights recently. We were a bit concerned after reading mixed trip advisor reviews. We didn't get the upgrade that many other reviewers have mentioned -possibly because were allowed to check-in around 11 am (well before the 2pm advertised check-in time - which was much appreciated). We found the staff efficient, friendly and helpful. Rating for this establishment seems to vary between 3 and 4 stars depending on which website you look at. We rated it nearer 3 than 4 and the tariff reflects this. Room was comfortable and clean. At night, there was a bit of traffic noise from the street below but after walking our legs off all day we had no trouble sleeping. The hotel is located close to public transport and it was only a short bus ride to Circular Quay. As in many big cities, the area around the central train station is often not the most salubrious part of town and we found that to be the case here. On Friday and Saturday nights the surrounding precinct seemed to have its fair share of vagrants, drunks and the 'ill at ease' but then again maybe that's just Sydney ! It wasn't a real concern for us as we were out and about with a group of Sydney friends but it may be a concern for older travellers and those travelling on their own. We thought that the hotel was good value, transport is handy and the friendly helpful staff were a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have been better!”
Reviews.Author: monicamaree64
Reviews.Content: I recently had an appointment in Sydney. I booked this Hotel for 4 nights, and I was highly impressed! The staff were friendly, courteous and professional and I really appreciated their assistance with all the questions I had for them. I also appreciated the free newspapers every day. I had an executive room with a "cloud" king sized bed, which was incredibly comfy, and the room was newly refurbished, with modern, muted colours and very clean. I WAS on the 4th floor....yes, that floor that has the pool on it, but I never once smelled any chlorine and I have to say it was very handy to hop out of the pool, put my waffle weave dressing gown on (supplied by the hotel) and wander down to my room! It was in a VERY convenient spot (about 5 mins walk from Central station) and we walked to Chinatown for dinner, to the markets and a host of cafe's and shops in the area. The last night I was there, I had a Thai massage which was absolutely fantastic. The massage ladies were really lovely and they did a great job of getting rid of those sore areas (especially on my back) with professionalism and good humour. I would absolutely recommend this hotel and I will be back!! Monica McSween

Reviews.Title: “Let down by lacking communication (of all types)”
Reviews.Author: 01re01
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on prior reviews and fantastic location in relation to proximity of Central Station. Upon first impressions the room looked modern, spacious and clean and the reception was friendly. Visit was spoiled by issues with Internet Connection in the hotel rooms and the failed attempts by the front desk staff to communicate the issue and to provide resolution. Management where not responsive to requests and suggestions around improving the front desk processes to ensure business travelers where aware of known internet connection errors up front and to ensure staff where advised of help desk details to pass on to guests (only received the Sebel IT help desk number after 3 calls to the front desk). Would have given the hotel another chance once refurbishment was complete...won't after my experience with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent... If the rate is good”
Reviews.Author: Cottboy
Reviews.Content: A good, central option if you get a good rate... I paid about $140 AUD for the night and it was close to central station (great access by train from airport), close to the entertainment districts and most other areas of Sydney you'd want to see. Room smelled a little stale - almost as if it used to be a "smoking" room, but bed was comfortable...TV had poor reception and the decor of the hotel looked a little dated. Foyer and reception looked very inviting though. Spent little time in the room, and would recommend if you were going to use this hotel as a base, rather than spending too much time in it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: diverbob62Uk
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Very central to everything and close to Chinatown for some great restaurants. Very average room, adequate but nothing special. Reception staff not very helpful and didn't even have a city map to help us. Managed to get a cheaper rate on a last minute site, so ended up pretty good value for inner city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Vanian
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute for a cheap price of around $130 a night. On check in we were told we'd been upgraded to an executive room, however it looked pretty standard to us. Recently refurbished it was still a little rough round the edges (no toilet roll holder?) and drafty windows. The main problem with the room was it was on the third floor, directly above what must be a bar or function room. Both nights people were stood outside talking and smoking. The smoke could be smelt through the drafty window, and conversations heard, making it hard to get to sleep. Other than that, it was comfortable with a small bathroom and large TV. Best thing was the location - only a few minutes walk to Central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayo8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week for 4 nights and found the whole experience fantastic. The staff were extremely pleasant and totally professional and helpful with any questions we had. We had a Executive room which was spotless. The pool area was really nice to visit after a hard days walking around and we went up to the sundeck most nights to cool down. We decided to bypass the breakfast as we were on a tight budget and opted to walk across the road to centennial plaza in the mornings to have breakfast there for $8 each, which included eggs bacon tomato toast AND coffee, a bargain. For three nights we went to Taylors on Central which is a 2 minute walk from the hotel for their steak dinners for $7 a head, which included a Steak with your choice of sauces chips and salad, another bargain! You can't beat this hotel for an easy commute into the city, Central Rail Station is only a couple of minutes walk, or you can walk down Elizabeth Street and catch a bus. I would not hesitate in recommending this Hotel! We plan on visiting again next year and will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine...but the service~!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: The Citigate is in a reasonable location and is quite well appointed. The room I stayed in was clean, well fitted out and very pleasant. On this basis, the hotel provides good value for money, at least at the discount rates available online. The service, however, was appalling. It was completely unprofessional and almost laughably inept. For example, when I arrived I requested internet access. I was told that this was available in the room (though the price, I should add, was absolutely absurd). When I got to the room, there was no cable. I rang downstairs and was told that one would be sent up. After half an hour, and very sick of waiting, I went down to reception to get a cable myself. After a long wait (both receptionists were in a nose-to-nose fight with a Chinese tour leader), I was eventually handed one. I took it up to my room....to find that my keycard no longer worked. Back to reception and more waiting. 6 hours later, as I was just drifting off to sleep, the reception desk rang.....apparently, they were 'too busy to bring a cable up to me and could I please come down and pick one up?'. I pointed out that I had already been down (many hours before) to pick one up...and they hung up on me. Charming folk. Unfortunately, the whole stay was like this. Anyway, not a bad hotel and it would be a fine option for a cheap Sydney stay in a reasonable level of comfort were it not for the truly awful service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Citigate Sebel”
Reviews.Author: LynCanberraAustralia
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for one night and had nothing to complain about. We found a great deal on the internet but as we had to book 2 rooms with 2 different bedding configurations, found this very difficult to do thru the net. Called the hotel directly and explained the situation and they matched the low internet price & also included breakfast for us all. Rooms were spacious, the pool area great after a long drive to Sydney, breakfast was a real feast and excellent quality food. Would happily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get to location”
Reviews.Author: mosanator
Reviews.Content: I stay in the Hotel once every month (for the last 3.5 years) for business and have never had any problems. The rooms have always been clean and tidy and have everything I need in them. The rooms have recently under gone refurbishment and all the ones I have been in now have LCD flat screens and new trendy bathrooms. I did point out in a feedback form I was given that they should have at least 1 full lenght mirror in the room, like they used too. It would have to be the easiest reasonably priced hotel in Sydney CBD to get to from the airport link train, get off at Central and it is 1.5 blocks away. I even take my family here now when visiting Sydney for fun. There is a secure parking garage ($10 a day) on the premises. Only thing I don't like about Citigate is it doesn't have a loyalty program.

Reviews.Title: “Citigate Sebel - worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: sthyorksguy
Reviews.Content: A great hotel situated very close to Central Station - perfect for getting around. The hotel itself is clean spacious and all round value for money. We got a free room upgrade so I really cant complain. I would definitely recommend it to anyone. The down side is that the hotel is in an area that could do with some regeneration. This hotel is close to China town and within walking distance of the main shopping areas, including Oxford St so perfect for the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Basic...but does the trick!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: My overall experience with this hotel was nothing memorable, but ideal for anyone on a budget and has basic needs. The exterior is pretty plain on the outside. The reception area is simple and basic. Some areas of the hotel look a little dated, but still looks like some effort has been made to maintain it. The room itself is pretty standard, with all the essentials of a room. Again, nothing too flash, but comfortable enough. The bathroom was nice and clean. The room had a window, but given its location, there is truly nothing to see outside. The hotel is located near Central station, which isn't much use unless you need to travel by train somewhere on a regular basis. Plenty of buses just close by as well. Chinatown is a nice easy walk. The city centre is a little bit more of a walk, about 10 minutes away. Overall, this is a decent hotel for a 3 star standard. It does the trick, if all you're looking for is a bed and access to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience”
Reviews.Author: JessicaBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over the weekend. We live in Adelaide, Australia and were flying over to Sydney to meet my cousin who was visiting from the UK. We were looking for a hotel for a weekend away that was handy for all the attractions and not too expensive and I think we found it. We had previously stayed at Simpsons at Potts Point in Sydney (number 1 on trip advisor) and we were surprised to say overall we found it comparable. Although it does not have the individuality and charm of Simpsons, the staff were all very friendly, the hotel seemed well maintained and there was a good selection at breakfast (although I agree with a previous report that the cooked breakfast items are only luke warm). The hotel also seemed very quiet when we were there even though there were plenty of guests at breakfast and in reception and we had a great couple of nights sleep. The location in relation to the train station and airport are great, only a 10 minute train ride from the airport. We were booked into a deluxe room but on arrival we had been upgraded to an executive room (not sure why) which was spacious, had a sofa and a chair in and a massive bed. Having read previous trip advisor reports on the hotel and the comments on the chlorine smells from the swimming pool I asked not to be put on the 4th floor and explained why and the receptionist smiled as though she knew what I was talking about. The only negative comment was the shower was fixed on the wall and was not very high. My boyfriend and I are both tall people and especially my boyfriend struggled slightly when having a shower, but this would not put us off returning. Overall a good value experience for a weekend away and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Improvement needed”
Reviews.Author: CoroTraveller
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed here. The first, a year ago was okay. This time wasn't up to scratch. The phone in the room didn't work and couldn't be fixed. The staff were cleaning my room before I had checked out even though my bags were still in the room. The hot food at breakfast was only luke warm. Mine may have been a one off bad experience but it was disappointing. The apology was sincere but I wasn't sure the problems would be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice facilities”
Reviews.Author: Blondcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights begining of June 2007. After staying at a 5star hotel 2 nights prior (see my Shangri La review), could notice the difference in hotel ratings. The room was large and comfortably furnished although the lack of valance around the bed made the room look a little cheap(which it wasn't). It was a 'refurbished' room (not sure which decade that occurred in). Pool, Sauna & spa facilities were in great condition and well serviced (better than Shangri La in my opinion). Staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. Had a couple of issues with the access card failure. I did notice in the lift that there was no security and anyone could travel to any level. Location was handy to everything and quiet, so would suit over 30's weekends away and business travelers. What I didn't appreciate was the false fire alarm at 7am on a Saturday morning. Having said that, the siren was loud within the room and could have waken the dead :-) A good overall experience and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney Weekender”
Reviews.Author: kiwiflyers
Reviews.Content: Brilliant choice of hotel for our weekend in Sydney. Excellent location for all public transport and shopping. Reasonable rates but paying an extra $10 for an upgraded room on a higher floor was definitely worth while. Plenty of choices for food and bars nearby so didnt try the hotel restaurant. Very helpful concierge and reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “I found Citigate Sebel to be fine”
Reviews.Author: daisycutter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on a business trip and the hotel was booked for me so I was apprehensive after reading earlier reviews. However I was pleasantly surprised by a very clean and comfortable room. It was a larger room than many others I have stayed in and quite OK for my stay. Service from the staff was consistently good and it is close to Central Station which was only a 10 minute ride from the Airport. Not where I would choose to stay for a romantic weekend but more than happy to use it for business visits.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Smelled of Chlorine”
Reviews.Author: kimita
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room and were extremely disappointed to check in and find that our room smelled strongly of chlorine -- it was on the same floor as the pool. When we complained at the front desk, a hotel representative snootily told us that there were no other rooms available and that a room like that was their standard. Then he turned his back on us. Despite that we had already paid for our hotel stay, we decided that it was better not to risk our health in a room smelling of chlorine and checked out that same day. Good thing we were still able to get a booking at Sofitel Wentworth. It was only upon hearing that we were going to check out that the hotel representatives offered us an alternative room. Apparently they were not fully booked as they originally claimed. We did not accept.

HotelInfo.Name: The Sebel Surry Hills
HotelInfo.Address: 28 Albion St | Surry Hills, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia (Formerly Furama Hotel Central)
